Summary: Stayed here for one night and I would highly recommend! The beds were very comfortable and the room is clean. I stopped here last minute and they were accommodating and friendly. They have a Starbucks in the lobby, which was great! Ask for a room on the pool side so that you don’t hear the highway 😊
Room tip: Ask for a room on the pool side so you don’t hear the highway!

Summary: We don't mind paying a bit extra for a Marriott so we get a better room than a lower cost hotel. However this one is over priced and out dated. The bed was worn out and noisy. The shower drained slowly. Worst of all the room smelled like urine. Not impressed. To top it off they charge for parking. Never again. Should have gone with a cheaper hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. As you are aware, our 2020 renovation was delayed, but we are happy to announce that it will be started later this year. This renovation will include mattresses, flooring, etc. Please do not ever stay in a room that is not comfortable for you. Always ask the front desk for a room transfer. We want all of our guests to be as comfortable as possible. I am sorry that you were displeased with this stay and I hope you will come again after our renovation.

Summary: Full of excuses from the hotel can’t get through Marriott corporate very disappointed! I’m not able to show the videos only photos… I was harassed by hotel management  and accused of. Management told me it was just only isolated in my room. It’s coming from the bathroom sink drain.
Manager Response: Dear PM925, I do see that your situation was researched and compensated. I apologize that you are still feeling this way after 2 months. This was something that we had never seen before or since, so it is is pretty safe to say that you will never experience it again. Thank you.

Summary: So 2 of my colleagues and myself, checked in on 1/3 for a company training for one week. The company paid for room, tax, parking and breakfast daily. I was asked for my card for incidentals (who even has incidentals anymore since everyone has a cellphone and a Netflix account, but I digress). My card was charged $1,000 for incidentals. Yes, you saw that correctly, $1,000. When I called down to the front desk, I was told it was a mistake and they apologized. They also comped my dinner for the evening. No worries, continued my week of training. I noticed however, at the end of the week, the $1,000 was still on my card. When I asked why, I was told by a different front desk agent that the hold was put on my card "just in case my bosses card did not go through." What? So if I was
Manager Response: Dear VickiK32655,  We apologize greatly for the troubles you encountered during your stay with us. Unfortunately we have had some staffing challenges with illness and training that occurred during your stays; those challenges are being addressed as quickly as possible. We all look forward to things getting back to normal very soon.

Summary: We stay one night at the courtyard in Costa Mesa California. It's about 2 miles away from South Coast Plaza which makes it convenient. Not too close to the freeway noise. Neighbors were noisy and apparently smoking pot. Pots melt seeping into room. Also the alarm in room chirping took Personnel over 20 minutes to deliver a replacement battery. Room is nice and clean. Nice view of a pool. Two TV s one in the living room area another in the actual room where the bed is located. Dining area closed but computer for guest use available. Fast foods and eateries located on main street.

Summary Heading: Loud guests, loud AC, needs an update
Summary: I wondered why this hotel was so cheap but trusted the 4 star reviews. I’m not sure who left them, but guess it is based solely on the price. For $100/night it’s not bad but definitely not what I’m accustomed to for a Courtyard. As a gold lifetime elite member I’ve stayed in many and this was probably the worst Courtyard I’ve ever stayed in. The good - the front desk staff was friendly, the pool was open despite COVID and looked nice. The bad - the hotel is dark and the hallways look like they haven’t been painted in decades. The AC in the room is extremely loud, so I shut it off and opened the balcony door. At 2:30am I was woken up by the sound of loud music and smell of weed so I was forced to close the balcony door and turn on the loud AC. I didn’t get much sleep. The room is
Manager Response: Dear Sue M, I'm sorry there were outside forces that interfered with your stay. We are staffed 24/7 and available to research any complaints you have at any hour. While we have had several parts of the hotel renovated, our rooms were due this year. Unfortunately the Global Pandemic interfered with those plans. Our last rooms renovation was in 2013. Also due to the pandemic, our state is not allowed to have indoor dining. Our website does advertise that some amenities may not be available. As the mandates are always changing, we have a generic statement there and follow the mandates here on property as they change. Fortunately we are currently allowed to have our pool open. Our rates do reflect the fact that we do not have all of our amenities available. As far as upgrades are concerned, we have very limited number of suites on property and they generally sell out, making complimentary upgrades very difficult. Thank you for taking the time to express your opinion. We all look forward to the day when things can get back to what we are used to.

Summary: I especially want to thank Paulina and Raphael for providing excellent service!  They both went above and beyond in ensuring we had a pleasant stay and making me feel like a valued Platinum Elite member.  It helped ensure that a trip with several challenges ended on a high note.  Additionally, this is a great value hotel in an excellent location -- close to freeways, great restaurants and South Coast Plaza.  Comfortable and quiet.  Thank you, especially to Raphael and Paulina!

Stayed for one night at $93 which was fine  Room was clean and bed was very comfortable  The in room coffee is horrible  Place is quiet and check in was easy  Not sure why they charge 10 parking fee but was very easy to get in and out

Very nice and clean ,, comfortable beds and love the hygiene products in shower , staff was very Friendly, went to go visit family for Xmas , glad I got a good night rest ,, didn’t have chance to try food

I was having some trouble because I was supposed to be staying at the Marriott on Anton Blvd, but they were under construction. Since they didn’t have heat or hot water, they sent me to a different Marriott in the area. Well, I typed the wrong Marriott in and again ended up at a Marriott I couldn’t stay in - this Marriott (this time the rooms were filled - this wasn’t their fault, I went to the wrong place). I was getting a little frustrated after going through everything after a long flight, and Ryan was more than willing to help out! It was 11 PM at this point, but he offered to drive me personally to the right Marriott in the Marriott shuttle. My mood immediately shifted because I was just so grateful for his kindness and willingness to help out! So thank you Ryan!!

Summary Heading: One of the worst Marriott properties I have ever stayed
Summary: I am giving this three stars only because some of the people that work here are decent at their jobs and the location is not horrible.  Guessing the problem is that this is one of the least expensive places to stay in the area and you sort of get what you pay for.  One night there was a guest screaming at the top of their lungs in the hallway, not once but three times (in the middle of the night).  I called the front desk however they told me they could not identify where it was coming from so they do nothing about it.  Also I went to the front desk to borrow a cork screw one night and the clerk said she would put a hold on my room until I returned it, really made me feel like scum. Also they charge $10 a day for parking which is definitely not mentioned anywhere n their
Manager Response: Dear johnbh12,  I am sorry there was someone who decided to interrupt your stay in such an unpleasant manner. Security not being able to locate the disturbance is not the same as us doing nothing about it. I'm sorry that they were unable to locate the source.  I do apologize for the way you felt when borrowing our cork screw. We have replaced that item many times and have found the best way to get it back is to put a security hold on until it is returned. It is not our intent to make anyone feel a specific way about that procedure.  We do not advertise complimentary parking and I'm sorry it caught you off guard. I am very happy you were able to take advantage of the promotional rates we were offering.  Our many renovations, upgrades and enhancements are ongoing, as with every hotel. Our public spaces have been newly renovated and we are looking forward to our rooms renovation in 2020.  Thank you for your comments. They are not indicative of what we are used to, and I'm sorry you were so displeased. Perhaps you can try us again in the future without a guest screaming to disturb your stay.

Summary Heading: Good cheap hub for a California trip
Summary: We wanted a cheap place to stay in California so we could rent a car and drive around. Found this Courtyard to be very fair. The room wasn’t amazing but I wasn’t expecting luxury anyway. It was clean and comfortable and worth the cost.  Got an Amazon package delivered there and they didn’t charge me to receive and store, which is good. A lot of food options around but not walking distance.  Just set the right expectations and you will have a nice stay. It was a 5 star experience for me because I knew what to expect, but don’t compare this one to other category 5 and above marriott hotels.

These people do a great job! They are on top of any request with a smile. My bedside lamp wasn't working and the houseman was there is five minutes to find the problem, and he did. We were also able to bring our expensive bikes in the room, no problem. The only complaint we had was that the air conditioner shut off for hours in the middle of the night, and when it started again, it smelled very musty.

We needed to stay overnight because work being done on the house. We chose Marriott because they always have great beds and comfortable rooms. This place is located on the busiest street in the area. And a front facing room will be noisy early in the morning. If you want that location you have to deal with the noise. The evening was peaceful and we got great rest. The only reason I am writing this review is to complain about that stupid dish network that would not let me watch the game anywhere besides the lobby. Really? What brain trust thought this would increase traffic in the Bistro? Shame on you Marriott. Use the local cable company and let everyone watch the game.

Summary Heading: Stay only if you LOVE road noise
Summary: I had to knock off a full 2 stars for the extreme amount of road/traffic noise. It's the loudest room I've ever had, and it wasn't due to construction or any unusual circumstances. I travel with a white noise machine for hotels like this but it couldn't block out the sound coming in.  Other than the road noise...great fitness center. All three treadmills worked well. Two benches for lifting.  Not overly far from restaurants but not walking distance to anything.  Overall would stay again if I didn't get stuck in a road facing room.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. We just, this week, finished our ongoing project to add double doors and double paned windows to every exterior facing room. I don't know which room you were in, but perhaps it was done this week. You might have seen them working while you were here. I'd love to check on the room you were in if you would provide me with your name or the room number and date you stayed. Noise from outside should no longer be a problem. Sorry you encountered it during your stay. I hope you will return in the future. Thanks again!

Summary: Stayed two nights here as I traveled the state.  Relatively quiet considering the location, one evening I could hear the Disneyland fireworks.  Was very impressed with Paulina on the front desk, she greeted each person, many by name as they entered or exited the hotel.  She was very helpful to me with finding someplace nearby to eat.    Room was well equipped and comfortable, didn’t appreciate a separate parking charge however.

We have stayed many nights at various Marriott properties and I have to say the staff at this Courtyard takes the cake for best. Tiffanie was there to greet us and engaged with our teenagers. She promptly checked us in and answered all of our questions and was eager to help in any way possible. At checkout, Tiffanie and Erin were so kind to find bandaids for me as I was nursing a blister on my heal. The rooms were clean. The fridge was great. My only complaint was the $10 parking fee for a suburban hotel - which is uncommon. Just make sure you work that into your budget for the stay. I definitely highly recommend this hotel. Tell Tiffanie and Erin hello for us!

I travel a ton, so I feel like it takes a lot to Impress me. However, this hotel checks all the boxes. Front desk staff....fabulously attentive and very friendly. Bistro staff....efficient and sweet....our food was great. Housekeeping staff....room was spotless and the housekeeper was very nice. We will definitely be back!

If you are on a short trip and do not need fully furnished rooms like the one without kitchenette , you can choose Courtyard by Marriott. Breakfast has good menu options though it is on paid basis. Courteous staff.

The hotel’s fine - pleasant reception staff, clean room (not on a high floor that my profile specifies and having checked in online the day before, I’d expect one), good bed. The sort of consistency you expect from Courtyard.  What REALLY annoys me is the nickel-and-diming $8/day parking fee. It’s a recent development, they haven’t had increased costs and they’re ripping off a captive market. Now I’m waiting for a response from the hotel management, because his/her staff sure couldn’t justify it.
Manager Response: Dear valued guest,  Thank  you for taking the time to review our hotel. We have been charging for parking since 2017 in an effort to maintain the safety and integrity of our parking lot and the hotel. We have outside security here 7 days per week, and the parking fees help to offset that extra cost.  Thank you again for staying with us.

Summary: Only stayed one night but our room was very clean and the staff was excellent and very helpful. Had a slight issue with the television and maintenance had it fixed in less than 5 minutes total.  Definitely would stay here again if in the area.

Summary Heading: Balcony but don't expect a view.....
Summary: I stayed 6 days for business trip. Located in a busniess district, no shopping or eateries in walking distance. Exterior neat and clean with plenty of parking at all hours. Interior lobby contemporary decor, again very clean and inviting. I have to say ALL employees at this hotel were exceptionally nice, warm and welcoming....from the front desk to the Bistro employees, housekeepers and especially the security guard who never failed to give me a friendly greeting when I arrived back to hotel in early morning hours. The Bistro food was surprisingly good. My work hours don't allow for breakfast but I did order dinner a few times and it was cooked perfectly and delicious. As for the room....I'm sorry to say I was a bit disappointed. Although it was clean...there is an odor when you
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments. We pride ourselves in the cleanliness of our hotel and the kindness of all of our staff.  Courtyard hotels don't generally provide kitchen appliances like our Residence Inn and other select brands do. The refrigerators we provide are small enough to stay in a cabinet as to not take up space in the guestroom.  Thank again for staying with us and your comments.

Summary Heading: Clean, spacious hotel in Santa Ana
Summary: We left Los Angeles and arrived in the evening, in a very quiet area. Ample parking. Very friendly receptionist in an otherwise quiet but spacious lobby and seating area, beautifully decorated for Christmas. In the morning, it was beautiful to look out over the courtyard pool area, which is just not stark and bare, but surrounded by palm trees.  We could sit outside on a balcony and enjoy the sunrise and breakrast purchased in the cafe downstairs. The only negative was the cafe employee, who was not only quite reluctant to serve us, but seemed bothered by our presence and rude. Otherwise, would stay again.

If you are looking for a moderate hotel that is clean, quiet, and friendly, this is your place!  Extremely clean, comfortable bed, quiet room, and well maintained grounds.  My daughter and I stayed here four nights while we visited Disneyland properties and attended a show at the Segerstrom center.  I am a Marriott gold member, so I’ve stayed in my share of properties.  This property is not frilly, so if that’s your expectation this may not be place for you, but for value, cleanliness and comfort, it’s perfect.

We booked this hotel because we are Marriott Rewards members and try to book through Marriott as often as we can when reasonably priced. This hotel was about 15 min from family we were visiting and less expensive than the Huntington Beach Marriott. Staff was very welcoming and helpful. Location of room was great and opened to the courtyard and pool with a lovely view. Appreciate the patio although a little too cold to enjoy. The room itself was fine, spacious and clean and exactly what I’d expected. The lobby was nice and welcoming and I appreciated the holiday decor.   My one complaint was the staff working the cafe in the morning, she was not pleasant or friendly. The in-room coffee just didnt cut it so my husband and I purchases drip Starbucks coffee as well. She seemed

Quiet hotel with spacious rooms and very friendly service. Was just disappointed when I saw a $10 parking charge on my bill which was not disclosed during booking or check in. No big deal but the hotel has plenty of parking and it should’ve not been a surprise. AAA price was $107 which was a good deal.

The staff are nice but the hotel needs a facelift especially guest rooms . Also it has many open areas and entrances that I’m not sure if I think it’s a great place for a woman to stay. There are other marriotts close by I like better .
Manager Response: Dear Luckydog17 - Thank you for your comments. Our hotel is going through renovation in phases. I'm sure you noticed the beautiful lobby, exercise room, swimming pool, etc. Our rooms are next.  As far as the entrance doors around the property, they are all locked and can only be accessed with a valid guest room key.  Thank you again and we hope to see you in the future.

Summary: Note: I'm a Marriott Platinum member, so I don't know how my experience will fare compared to the non-elites.  We came here for one night stay because we have a wedding to attend to nearby on a Sunday morning, and we thought we would make a little staycation out of it.  The check-in staff was lovely; we were preemptively upgraded to a suite.  Rock on.  However, when we walked into the room, the room had that stinky AC smell: like mold and bacteria had been growing in the coils for a while.  The room was quite dark, and the layout was not well designed.  Frankly I'm surprised the rooms have not been updated already; they look like they are about 30 years old.  The lobby was updated with several TVs for those who want to watch sports in the lobby.  As an elite, we were given $10
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for your response. I am happy that you received an upgrade and nice service upon arrival. I am surprised at the comment regarding the room. All of our King and Double Suites are on the Courtyard side, so it is a little shadier on that side of the property, which would make your room darker than room on the exterior side. Also, all of our Suites have brand new A/C units in them and may have some "new" smell to them. I will definitely have our engineering department check all of them for any odor that you have described.  Our lobby just finished its renovation and we are right on schedule for our rooms renovation. Our rooms were last renovated in 2013. We are looking forward to getting another one.  I am sorry you didn't like the burrito. It is a breakfast burrito, so it includes eggs and potatoes which makes it different than a regular lunch burrito that would be a little spicier. All of our food is made fresh on the premises.  I hope that you will return in the future to enjoy our beautiful hotel and its amenities.   Thanks again.

Summary: This is our second time to stay here for 10 days ! We love the tranquility , spacious room , friendly staff , convenience to all the shopping centers , the cleaning ladies provide very good service .   Can we suggest to have the  shower douche for some rooms for old peoples !  LOVE OUR ROOM 418  We shall be back again !

We stayed at this hotel while in Orange County, the hotel was clean, comfortable, convenient to where we were going. However, it is located in a more industrial area, which limits options for close by dinning, shopping, or even places to walk to. There was a large wedding party that was at the hotel during our stay, and they at times were noisy in the hallway.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, I'm glad you enjoyed our hotel. I do apologize for the noise disturbance during your stay. I hope you were able to enjoy our Bistro for delicious food options, or our Market for quick pick up items. We are 2.5 miles from the beautiful South Coast Plaza shopping center with hundreds of wonderful food options. We are also only 1.0 miles from SOCO with other options. I'm sorry if those weren't pointed out to you during your stay. Maybe on your next time here you can venture out and see all the great things near us. Thanks again for taking the time to review your stay.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel because I was taking a 4 day course up there. It's too far to drive back and forth from San Diego. The rooms were nice and clean. The carpet was freshly cleaned so it was a touch musty. They were doing some upgrading to the hotel but it wasn't bad out intrusive. There little bistro needs a serious revamp as it really wasn't much of a bistro. The tables and chairs needed to be tossed immediately as they were shredded. Then came the fact that they charged $10/night for parking... really? I've stayed in this quality hotel in this area before and they didn't charge for parking. I would most likely stay there again because I liked the room but I'll eat somewhere else and park next door like I saw some guests doing.
Manager Response: Dear Chris,   Thank you for your review. As you stated, we were under renovation in our lobby/Bistro area during your stay. The furniture that you mentioned has been replaced as part of that renovation.  We charge for parking and require a parking pass in an effort to maintain the security and integrity of our parking lot. We have outside security that monitors our lot and ensures that no one from properties next door park in our parking lot. It is a nominal fee compared to many of the hotels in this area.  I hope you return to see the changes we have made. Thanks again.

Summary Heading: A very solid choice that's difficult to fault
Summary: Pros: Proximity to many area attractions, great staff, reasonable prices, clean and comfortable guest rooms Cons: Not much to do in the immediate area, parking fee doesn't seem right  While there isn't much to do within walking distance of this hotel, the fact that it sits between Newport Beach and Disneyland is a huge plus. Most area hotels don't have that kind of selling point.  This Courtyard offers much of what's expected of the brand's offerings these days, including a bistro in the lobby that serves Starbucks and breakfasts in the morning and simple meals and alcoholic drinks in the evening hours. The staff at this particular bistro is exceptional. The rest of the lobby was being renovated during our stay, so it will likely be very nice when complete.  The pool area in the

My husband and I stayed here for three nights. It was quiet, was conveniently located close(ish) (within a half hour drive) to some good beaches, and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful! The room smelled a little musty and we were a little concerned for a car since there had been reports of break-ins recently. But the hotel did a great job at posting extra security and we thankfully didn’t have anything damaged or stolen! Overall a very nice stay.
Manager Response: Thank  you for your comments. We appreciate your business and hope to see you again.

Summary: Clean and comfortable rooms Friendly staff Good pool  Food pretty good too But the location is best thing , close to beach , shops and airports with Los Angeles on your doorstep and only an hour to San Diego

Summary Heading: Great but you pay for parking
Summary: The hotel staff was awesome, everyone was very friendly and helpful. They give large towels if you are heading to the beach. Pool is clean, fitness room is ok (very basic). Business center has everything you might need. Lots of outdoor seating and 2 fire pits, separate from the pool.  (we actually brought in food one night and ate on the patio). My biggest issue is that they charge $10 a day for parking, we were told it was because they have a security guard. I was taken a bit off guard by this because I haven’t been charged for parking at a Marriott in years. For this reason, I would look for another hotel next time we visit.

This is a place that a business person would expect to be like. Clean and it has a large Courtyard area where the pool is. They don't tell you that there's a $10 parking fee and there is no free breakfast. 15 minutes to beaches. Near 405 and 55 freeways. No nearby restaurants or nightlife. Kind of industrial area but not bad.

I stayed at this location for work. It was conveniently located by a very upscale mall close to the airport and major freeways. My room was comfortable and clean. It had a fridge, coffee machine, tv and other standard amenities.  The room was spacious. There was a bistro with Starbucks.  I had a room in the back which could get loud by people in the pool. But overall comfortable stay. Staff was nice.

This courtyard is very similar to other courtyards. The confusing part about the courtyards is that their rate changes depending on the day you stay there - ranging anywhere from $129.00 to $179.00 and when they consider a peak time. Also, at most of the courtyards in California you have to pay per vehicle to park. At this courtyard it is $10 which is ridiculous, but be prepared to add that to your bill as well as city and room taxes. It is obvious that the courtyard owns this property (they’re not leasing it) and it is in the middle of an industrial area, not a prime area for parking. Our room was clean and spacious, but like most of the courtyards I have stayed in recently, they are a bit dated. Popcorn ceilings, old wall paper, small sink counter area, and tile in the

Summary Heading: Best Value in the Huntington Beach area
Summary: We needed to attend a party at a Huntington Beach venue and instead of shelling $200 for a 2 star hotel with the Huntington Beach address, we found this place, 10min. away by car, which we liked very much. Note that you have to budget $10 for parking (street parking is not available). The crew was very helpful and pleasant to interact with. The pool area was neat although there was no jacuzzi.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. I am glad you enjoyed your stay. We do provide security 7 nights per week to monitor the hotel and the parking lot, thus the $10 fee. We removed our Jacuzzi to have a larger exercise room, that is used far more often by our travelers than the hot tub was. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: Just not what I'm used to with Marriott
Summary: First of all, the good.  The grounds were very nice and the hotel staff very friendly. The hotel is very reasonably priced.  The bed was also quite comfortable.  We checked into our room #244.  It had a bad smell and you could tell they sprayed to cover up whatever it was.  Almost smelled like dog urine...could have just been smell from a water leak somewhere.  I called the front desk and asked if all of the rooms smelled this way and the girl said, "I can send someone up to spray if you like."  This didn't answer my question. I just couldn't get past the smell.  I never became nose blind to it. The air conditioner kicked on and off almost constantly during the night too.  The toilet had to be flushed twice every time to get paper to go down...very wasteful.   In the future, I
Manager Response: Thank you for you kind comments about the hotel and staff.  I do apologize for the odor problem you encountered. Occasionally our rooms are left with a less than pleasant odor and it takes a little time for it to dissipate. That is not the norm. When we are not sold out, we are able to put those rooms out of order during that time, but in your case we did not have that extra time and I am sorry for that. We are constantly working on projects to improve the hotel and the other items are being addressed.  Thanks again.

Summary: A decent property in a convenient location.  Easy in/out onto the access road.  I was there 5 nights and didn't experience any problems.  The patio that faced the pool was nice.  Grounds were very well maintained. Only complaints were that the room had a musty smell...probably from the AC unit.  This was fixed with a candle.  Also, they charge for parking, which I thought was a bit excessive since it was a suburban location.  Maybe that's the norm in CA?  Not sure.

Stayed here two night for work a few miles down the street. At check in, Pauline was great. Super polite, personable, helpful, and engaging. Most places I’ve stayed just want to check you in and get back to what ever they’ve got going on. She took the time to have a conversation with me which was kind of nice to not feel rushed.  The room was the usual room for the Courtyards. It was clean and had a pleasant smell. Ac unit was quiet and never woke me up once when it kicked on. The bed was a bit on the firm side but still comfortable. Overall appearance was nice.   For someone who travels regularly, the customer services is what makes or breaks a visit for the chain hotels. This was by far my most pleasant experience.   Thanks again.

Summary Heading: Good Business Hotel - recently refreshed, great rates for the area
Summary: Booked for last minute business travel, great rate for same day booking.   Free in-room and lobby internet.  Hotel recently refreshed, all new including lobby, halls and rooms themselves.   Front desk on check in and check out could not have been nicer or more helpful.   Check in was a breeze, delivered on the requested items (feather pillows, higher floor).  Very nice fluffy towels, new shower head.   Would stay there again,
Manager Response: Thanks cerberus2016 - So happy you enjoyed your stay!

Summary: The hotel is very good for business travel, it has nice rooms, it is quiet and comfortable. The "Bistro" restaurant/bar is good enough for a business hotel. The personnel is quite friendly and nice. In my experience, all the areas of the hotel are clean and tidy. I didn't went to the pool but I could see it for my room and looked nice, 90% of the time is empty so if you are a pool person, you won't be disturbed. It is very near 405, which means good location and fast access to highways. Is close enough to Newport beach, so you can escape if you have a few minutes. Also, is close to Outlets at Orange which is a nice outlet, which nice stores. Also de South Plaza mall is near enough. All in all, is the best business hotel I have stayed on the Orange County area.

Got in late on a Friday eve & staff was great. Had to park 16ft moving van and parking staff went out of their way to insure it was safe. Front desk was happy and smiling even though U knew they would rather B somewhere else on Friday eve. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: So happy we were able to help Thanks for taking the time to comment.

Summary Heading: A fine gem in Costa Mesa!
Summary: Another amazing stay at the Courtyard Costa Mesa. Just a few minutes from the beach, this is gem! Front desk staff was amazing and made the check in painless and enjoyable! Whaaaat?? Yes, enjoyable! The surrounding area has everything to offer. Shopping and plenty o' food choices within minutes just west on Harbour Blvd. towards the beach. Beach area is only 5 to 10 minutes. Balcony rooms overlooking the pool are wonderful.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. I am so glad you enjoyed your stay with us!

Summary: I am at this hotel, which is in Santa Ana, right now.  My husband booked it after I had asked him to book the Marriot Courtyard in Irvine.  He tried to change the reservation a few minutes later, and Marriot refused, so we are stuck here.  It is an industrial area of Santa Ana, surrounded by mattress outlets and fast food chains.  It is 4.7 miles from Costa Mesa, so not sure why it's called Costa Mesa.  It is almost 7 miles from the beach.  Very disappointed...  Think carefully before you click confirm, because there is no going back if you made a mistake.  Their customer service is unforgiving.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you were not happy with our location. We are conveniently located at the border of Santa Ana, Costa Mesa and Fountain Valley in a very quite area. I don't see a record of your stay, but perhaps it was in a different name. You didn't comment at all about the hotel, so I assume it was much more pleasant than your initial reaction from our parking lot. Now that you know more about this actual hotel and the staff within the hotel, I hope you will give us another try in the future.

Summary: I stayed here for 2 nights and had no issues. Lobby and guest room were very clean. Check in process was easy. I did mobile check in and my room key was ready when I arrived. Although I requested a room close to the elevator, my room was located at the very end of the hallway, furthest from elevator. Housekeeping staff was very friendly. Not sure why they charge $10/night for parking as the area seems to be industrial/business parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell about your experience. I am glad you enjoyed yourself. I would like to clarify that we have 2 elevators on property, so no one is every very far from the nearest one.  In an effort to keep our parking lot just for our customers, and not for the other businesses around or the concert hall across the street, we implemented the need for parking passes, which do come with a small fee. Our security team helps to maintain that integrity and the security of our lot for all of our guests.  Thanks again for your comments, and I hope you'll visit again.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but unfortunately super loud guests present
Summary: We stayed here for a night recently and could not find a good night sleep. Hotel is nice, room is nice and clean, lobby is all new, staff was friendly. The only problem was a huge group of people that stayed at the hotel with a bunch (around 30) of kids, that went all in at the pool till 10PM and after that kept the party going in the walkways of the hotel. Talking to those people and  complaining at the reception did not change anything. It was super loud until 11:30PM and it started getting super loud again at 1:30AM. We had to get up at 6AM as we had a sports event....
Manager Response: Dear Andi,  I am so sorry to hear about the noise you encountered from other guests. There was a sports team that apparently did not follow the quiet after 10pm rule. We do have security on duty and do our best to keep people quiet after hours. I'm sorry that this didn't happen in this case. I hope that you can try us again when there is not a tournament in town, to see what the hotel is really like. Thanks again.

Summary: Our team stayed here for a softball tournament. The hotel itself wasn't bad. We had a king bed with a sofa sleeper for a family of 3. Once the bed is out there's not much room for anything else. The pool is small but the kids had a great time. There are a lot of stores/restaurants nearby so there are plenty of options for eating or shopping if you forgot something (i.e. Target, RiteAid, etc.).
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We are thrilled that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again.

Summary Heading: Conveniently Located in the Heart of Orange County
Summary: Clean, comfortable and... it's a Courtyard! Predictable quality and conveniences. Staff was pleasant and the room was enjoyable. Bed was wonderful and the snack bar was well-stocked. Conveniently located in the heart of Orange County.

The staff was nice and very friendly. The hotel is clean and appears to have been recently updated.  Not a lot of hotels in the area.  The only downside of this hotel is no free breakfast,  Starbucks is the onsite restaurant vendor so there is a reasonably priced Starbucks breakfast and coffee, wine and snacks are available in the evening

Summary Heading: The place to stay if you are going to a show at The Observatory!!
Summary: Was in town for a show at The Observatory and a quick day at Disneyland and very glad this was my choice. Hotel is within a easy walking distance from the venue so you can skip the cost and hassle of trying to park at the venue and make a stay cation of out it!  Attempted to check in early but was certain I may not be able to due to it being early and busy but I was nicely greeted upon arrival and was asked to wait only about 20 minutes before my room was available. Rooms were very nice and looked recently renovated.  Not to many dining options nearby so you may have to plan a bit ahead for a late night bite to eat. We decided to skip the drive and parking to Disney and took an uber to and from.  So glad I did as it was only a $10ish ride each way and get dropped off and picked

Me and my boyfriend checked in yesterday this was our first vacation in a while and was much needed (please note we both work in the hotel industry one of us is a manager so we are not unreasonable or New to check in practices) but upon check in we were given nothing but a hard time with our discount form made to feel like we were trying to alter things on it ect. When we asked to speak to a manager for assistance the man at the counter patted the counter and said I was just trying to help you but whatever, which is wildly unprofessional! Then the manager came out and was no more help. By the time we got to check in (without the discount form because they made any excuse not to accept it even though we've used it before at another hotel with zero issues) my boyfriend was
Manager Response: I'm sorry that we were unable to verify the discount form presented upon check in. We realize that those forms are being sold on the internet and I hope that you are able to get your money back for what you paid for it. We were able to check you in at our regular rate and your stay had no further issues. Since you said you both work in the hotel industry, I'm sure you are aware of the rampant fraud associated with employee discounts. Thank you for bringing this to our attention to remind us to continue our vigilant approach to this policy.

Summary: On Sunday passed midnight I had a medical emergency and did not have a home to go to. This area was the perfect location for me. As an associate I thought I could count on MARRIOTT since I consider it my second home. But now I fear to stay here or have any guest experience what I experienced. They showed zero type of hospitality, compassion, or sympathy. I was amaze as how I was treated while standing bleeding, in excruciating pain, and agony during the checking process. I really did not have any option since I needed a place to sleep just for a couple of hours after a long day I had gone through. I Thank you deeply Paula for showing me zero hospitality on my first and only stay there.
Manager Response: Astrid,  I am sorry to hear that you had a tough day. You say you are an employee of Marriott, yet you have failed to follow any Marriott procedures. I have no idea who you are, other than your first name, or what incident you are speaking of. I have no records of anything like this happening. Your hotel, or the management of this hotel is who you should be discussing this with, so that we can investigate. You have left me with no options. If you would like to discuss this further, and give me specifics, please reach out to the hotel directly.

Summary Heading: Pretty Property with helpful, kind staff
Summary: Stayed here during a biz trip and found it very comfortable.  Nice property, pretty strong fitness room, and beautiful pool area.  I also liked that there's an excellent diner (Suzy's Diner) walking distance away.  Great place for breakfast or lunch.

No idea how the pool or gym are... but there is free WIFI and a great lobby bar and cafe. BTW, Libby has Starbucks. Major win! Room was fine but not spectacular - a bit dated and carpet needs replaced. Staff was exceptional ally friendly. Would stay again.

Comfortable and always consistent. This chain always performs as expected.  Rooms clean, safe and comfortable.  The market available for snacks and the restaurant available for food and drinks.  This hotel is located within driving distance of the beach, shopping and amusement parks. I've been here a few times and would gladly stay again.

Although I was traveling alone, as I checked in the modern lobby/lounge area was a hub of activity with it set up to allow groups to gather and work or just meet. It is very modern with food and a coffee bistro. The bed was also very nice and I slept soundly.

I came to Courtyard Costa Mesa for a Seminar.  The rooms were spacious and the beds were comfortable. Desk Agents Eric and Paulina are excellent at Customer Service. The hotel itself is surrounded by business parks. The layout of my room was a little awkward. The bed faced the window and the tv was to the right of the bed. There was noisy construction involving doors that went on for a while. Overall, good stay.

This property is situated in a commercial/business park area. Lower than usual rate BUT they charge a $100 room deposit, front desk states it's due to a local concert hall that attracts Guests who get rowdy and trash the rooms and they require the large deposit. Beds comfy room a good size, not too many toiletries but they were able to give me a toothbrush and paste, since I forgot mine from home. Donut star down the street has great donuts.
Manager Response: Dear AmySD,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Courtyard Costa Mesa South Coast Metro with us.   One of our key priorities is to provide the highest level of friendly and courteous service. While it was a pleasure having you here as our guest, your feedback regarding the service our team provided caught my attention. I am very sorry to learn that the quality of service provided by our front desk staff did not quite meet your expectations. The security deposit taken during check-in is a hold every guest provides. Every Marriott property is different and some require a larger or smaller deposit, but this is something every hotel requires. Please rest assured that your comments have been shared with the team in an effort to improve our arrival experience.  Thank you for staying with us we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Santa Ana.   Sincerely, RAFAEL PAULINO

Summary: everything was nicer than I had anticipated.  Good bed, quiet, clean, nice towels, ...plenty of parking right by the door to the stairs, check-in was fast, good view of interior yard/pool, good heater, ....

Great staff.  Eric at the front desk was charming.  He gave us good recommendations of local restaurant.  The bistro barista was friendly.  Our room was spacious and the bed luxurious.  I think the pool will be great after they finish refurbishing it.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your  kind comments regarding our staff. We take great pride in our service, and I will pass on your words to Eric. Thanks again!

Summary Heading: Great stopover - great staff and dacilities
Summary: We stayed 2 nights here as we were going be to a concert nearby. All staff were great, rooms and beds were comfortable and facilities like the gym and laundry were great to have access to. Equipment in the gym was pretty dated and TVs didn't work but at least there was a gym. Staff in the cafe were also lovely and helpful. Free wifi and close to South Coast Plaza which is a great shopping centre

Summary Heading: Not a fancy location but a nice hotel nonetheless
Summary: This hotel is located in a business/industrial location so the surroundings aren't fancy, but it is every bit as nice inside as the Courtyards in other areas.  The room was clean and nicely decorated.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  There were many good restaurants within a 10 minute drive and there was easy access to the freeway.

Small gym. No bike to train just 3 treadmill of course busy early in the morning. Place looks very old, smelly particularly on the rooms. Air conditioning is really bad, very noise actually I turned it off so I could sleep.
Manager Response: Dear Jose Luis,   Thank you for taking the time to complete this review in regards to your recent stay at the Courtyard Costa Mesa South Coast Metro.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the noise complaints you experienced. I am happy to let you know that we are expecting new equipment for our gym facility. We unfortunately did not receive any reports regarding your problem with our air conditioning unit. We have shared your feedback with the appropriate hotel team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Santa Ana.   Sincerely, RAFAEL PAULINO rafael.paulino@marriott.com

Summary: I spent one night there and it was a pleasant stay. It is a convenient location for John Wayne Airport and there are several restaurants within a couple of miles.  The hotel is nice and the staff that I interacted were superb  Eric B. checked me in and provide excellent local information as well as an excellent restaurant recommendation and he needs to be recognized.  The only negative comment I have is that the rooms did not have a book with Hotel information and they also did not provide a channel guide for TV.

Planned for numerous VPs to stay at this hotel because always thought it was nice. Not the case. They complained of: •	toilets flooding with gunk overnight •	bugs in bed •	blood on curtains  Needless to stay, we will not be staying there again.
Manager Response: Dear SoCalTravelers2014,  We sincerely apologize and do regret that your guests were not able to enjoy their stay at the hotel. I would very much like the opportunity follow up on the issues you mentioned and be able to share your feedback with the appropriate staff members to ensure that these events are a one time occurrence. If you would be so kind as to contact me at the hotel directly, I would greatly appreciate it. I can be reached at (714) 545-1001.  I look forward to hearing from you soon.  Sincerely,  Alisa F.

Summary Heading: Convenient location but short stays only
Summary: The Courtyard Marriott Costa Mesa is located conveniently off the 55, close to South Coast Plaza, and not far from John Wayne Airport. Nestled in between newer apartment buildings the decor is modern. The rooms however were small and had some questionable design characteristics. The bathroom door covers the main access. The stay was fine for a night or two if you are not spending time in the room. The pool is located directly adjacent to the main entrance and really lacks any privacy... Access through the main lobby by the front desk.   Parking is limited although they told us they "share" a parking structure. Although numbers were provided for vehicles, when departing the normally weekend open gates were closed. The Help button did not connect and the only way we "escaped" was
Manager Response: Hello Brian,  It sounds like the Hotel you are describing is actually the Courtyard Santa Ana Orange County on 8 MacArthur Place which has a parking structure and is located near apartment buildings.  We are the Courtyard Costa Mesa South Coast Metro On Harbor Blvd.   Nevertheless, we are sorry to hear that your stay did not meet your expectations. If there is anything I can do to assist you, please do not hesitate to contact me.   Sincerely,  Alisa.

Summary: This is a very beautiful hotel. I wasn't jazzed about being given an accessible room and not sure why I was issued a handicap access room as I would hope those are left for those that need it. I had to cross a courtyard to get to my room which was likewise weird. But the room was clean and the bed was comfy. The room has a great sliding glass door, to no avail it leads to a landscaped area with deep ground cover so I'm not sure why all the trouble but it's not a big deal, just awkward. I think it would make sense if the room was near the pool area. It's a decent places to stay.

We were at first a bit hesitant due to poor accessibility to freeways but after a day or two we loved it. We will always stay here when a room to accommodate 5 is needed. The room was clean, and the pool was warm and clean with supply of beach towels.  ( They do need to enforce the posted rule of no children under 14yrs without adult at the pool.. I called the front desk, Paulina, about 4 noisy kids all under 14yrs but nothing was done). Starbucks available in the lobby 24 /7 was also awesome. We liked that there were two separate rooms, so the night owls did not affect the sleepers ! SATISFIED

We loved this hotel.  For the price, value and location it was hard to beat.  Every staff member we met was friendly, outgoing and went out of their way to help.  Plenty of free parking, and quality internet.  Definately will stay here next time we are in the area

I was visiting the area for a workshop and selected this hotel for its location in relationship to the workshop venue.  The hotel is in the midst of an industrial area so nowhere to walk for dining or shopping really but it's close to everything by car or uber.  About 20 minutes from John Wayne airport.    I requested a room facing the side parking lot to cut down on the street noise from Harbor Blvd.  The room was spacious and I had the best two nights of sleep I literally can remember.  The staff was incredibly helpful.  There were four of us in our group spread across different arrival and departure times.  Some of our party had flight arrival issues, one wasn't able to get there at all and we needed to reorganize room sharing.  The staff, with whom we were on a first name

I like the Marriott Courtyard hotels with the little gyms to work out, the convenient mini store in the lobbies, the convenience of some sort of food/drink concession.  Clean, comfortable, pleasant and safe. Knowing that you will get something consistent no matter which one you stay at is reassuring.

Summary Heading: Good stay for a busy Disney
Summary: We normally stay closer to Disney but as its summer there was not a lot of accommodation and prices are high so we stayed a little further away then normal.  It says approx 5.5 miles from Disney which is not bad but the location is on harbor and there are a lot of lights, it takes between 20 to 30 from Disney parking lot of Toy story to the hotel which is not bad at this time of year.  Parking is free in the hotel ... What a nice treat.  Our room was very comfortable no problems.  We ate dinner on our first night .... basic but tasted fine and did the job of filling us up.  Had no issues and found it good value for money

We stayed at the courtyard in Santa Ana for my daughters basketball tournament. We got a great  group rate. My only complaint that i have is at check in they did not informed us we had a continental breakfast included with our group rate and the times it was available. Before heading out my daughter wanted a bagel so we went to the restaurant and the super nice young lady with a bright smile; she knew or had an idea we were with the group and she gave us all the information and times for the continental breakfast super helpful. We had missed the continental breakfast that day since it was only available for 1 hour and we were not informed but she apologized and was able to give us a bagel very nice of her. She has great customer service. The next morning we made it to the

I've stayed here twice for business and have had a good experience.  I consider this a value hotel and so have adjusted my expectations accordingly.  The beds was comfortable and room was clean.  I would return.  I would say the main opportunities are bath related.  They give you those little bottles of shampoo and conditioner as most hotels do.  The issue here is that they are opaque and impossible to tell how much liquid is in them.  I found that they can be near empty since the housekeepers can't tell either.  The bottle for each (including lotion) are all the same color and I found extra lotion but no conditioner.  With long hair this is not good.  I left a note (and tip)  for housekeeping to leave leave more conditioner and upon return I had even more lotion and again, no
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for leaving us a review. We see that there is room for improvement based on your feedback. We have shared your comments with the appropriate hotel departments to ensure that moving forward, the issues will be corrected.  Again, thank you for taking the time to complete a review in regards to your recent stay at the Courtyard Costa Mesa South Coast Metro. We hope to host you again when your travels bring you back to Santa Ana.  Sincerely, Joy

Summary: This hotel is our go-to place when we are in town visiting family.  The location is central to all the necessary shopping/dining/excursions/freeways.  The staff are always friendly and accommodating.  The rooms are clean and comfortable, and noise is usually never a problem.  Some of the rooms facing Harbor Blvd can let in some of the road noise, but it dies down overnight.  On one occasion we requested a room away from the street and the front desk was more than happy to move us.  There is a bistro in the lobby, serving Starbucks coffee if that's your thing.  Food options are quite tasty, we usually sit down for a quick breakfast before heading out for the day.  Sitting areas inside and outside are comfortable, pool is good size, hot tub as well.  All the usual Marriott chain

A nice older property, but it's kept up nicely. Clean and bright. Pool area was nice. Very friendly service. I was upgraded to a two room suite with lots of room and windows and a comfy couch and mattress. Price was decent. And close to airport.

From the very beginning of researching hotels, to booking a meeting room, to Staff was a GREAT experience. Nikki, our contact for the event was very accomodating and made sure we had everything we needed for the event. She stored all the boxes I had to send and made sure the staff knew I was coming. Eric, Joy, Ariel, Rafael, and all the staff were there for my every wish to make the workshop wonderful for my guests as well as my stay. The rooms were clean and the beds wonderful. The common downstairs area was very modern and I noticed that people would gather there throughout the day so it was also inviting. They have a small restuarant on site and what food I did get was very good. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that would like to have a business event or are there to

Summary Heading: Lack of hot water hurts review.
Summary: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel, and will probably be my last. It is in a great location and the room was great, but the lack of hot water between 6AM and 7AM was not explainable. It took a long time to get hot water in the sink to shave. The only way I could keep hot water to rinse my razor was to leave the hot water on, letting it run wasting precious water.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay at the Courtyard Costa Mesa South Coast Metro.   As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the issue you experienced during your stay. We have shared your feedback with the Engineering team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.   We hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to the area.  Sincerely, Joy

Summary Heading: It would have been a 4 1/2 star but..
Summary: It would have been a 4 1/2 star but...My hotel stay for 2 nights were prepaid by Orbitz.com. They took my credit card for incidentals. At the time of check out, I was told, I was "OK" since it was prepaid.Few weeks later while looking at my credit card charges, I saw ANOTHER charge of the same amount!!! I have called my credit card for dispute and they themselves saw 2 payments of the same kind.So be very careful. Asked for a receipt for $0 balance at the time of check-out!!! Buyer's beware!!!!
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback in regards to your recent stay at the Courtyard Costa Mesa South Coast Metro.  As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our apology for issue you experienced. We have shared your feedback with the front desk team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.  Sincerely, Joy

Summary: The staff upon check-in was very polite and helpful. The hotel was nicely decorated and up-to-date on the decor. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The bathroom was also very nice. The balcony was small but enjoyable. Room service was very quick and I enjoyed the pizzas  that I had ordered. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that wanted to stay near the beach or travel there with their family. Also the hotel is wonderful for business trips.

Was indeed a very plesent stay at Courtyard Marriott in Santa Ana. The Hotel was very clean, Staff there are very Kind and Courteous, has a Nice Convenient mini-mart by the check-in, the rooms there are very clean and possess a nice little balcony. I also liked the location of this Hotel, for its only half a mile away from the Observatory, so very convenient if your plan was to see a show/concert. The only flaw was that there's no free water, there are water bottles available to buy but they're kinda expensive. So suggest you bring your own water. Especially if you're planning on staying for multiple days. Also if you're planning on bringing alcohol, ensure that you bring a good amount and bring a cooler (a fringe is provided in each room but it's too small too fit more then a 6

We have been to this property before, as we visit nearby family and then cycle on the nearby Santa Ana Trail.  Somehow the location seemed fresher and cleaner. No complaints here - and no problems. The lobby bistro was a bit pricy, but very convenient with fresh food, prepared while we waited.  We'll return and not even consider an alternative.

Best price by a lot for our stay here.  Rooms are great, nice TV and free wifi.  But a few things annoyed me.  The iron leaked.  Coffee was sparse only got two decaf pouches.  There is no room service.  The bar has only two stools, so most people have to order at the counter and sit at a table.  Two tiny tvs.  Limited choices for dinner cooked in a turbo oven.  Although the hamburger I had was really good.  Salads are great and humongous.  So although prices are great next time I'll choose a hotel with a great bar and a full restaurant.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I will forward your concerns to the housekeeping team to ensure this was an isolated issue.  We hope to see you again next time your travels bring you back to Santa Ana. Sincerely,  Joy

Summary: Really enjoyed the stay here on a business trip coming from Germany. nice rooms with good beds and a very good service team. Breakfast was also good - nearby Mall is just amazing. Looking forward to come back and jump into the pool again. Thanks!

Pros - clean looking, starbucks coffee, bistro, nic I staff, nice landscape (saw some orange trees around the property, which takes you back to the days when the area was agricultural growing oranges. I find that even though it is built next a major street, it seems  more   quiet of the many courtyard marriotts in the area. Many courtyards are built sandwiched between a freeway and a major street or a mall.  So, you get double the noise. This courtyard is in an industrial center.  Cons - you have to drive out of your way to get to the major shops and restaurants. There is way too much furniture polish or cleaning solutions in the lobby - the smell is so strong, it permeates the entire first floor. If you have allergies to perfumed smells, this is not your place. The laundry room

Wonderful hotel. Lovely pool area and large, clean, spacious rooms    Very accommodating friendly staff    Property has a lush vacation look and feel to it. Starbucks coffee in the lobby. Yay ! no free breakfast but s small bistro area in the lobby where you can get food

Stayed here a couple of times and it's a nice hotel but the staff is not helpful. After realizing I had misplaced my credit card and last recalled using it at the hotel, I called the hotel to ask for their assistance in locating it. Very unhelpful. So sure was I that I left my credit card at the hotel that I drove an hour out of my way the following day to return to the hotel to look for it myself. Again the staff was unhelpful. I received a phone call the following day that the hotel had located my credit card. Never an apology for not assisting me earlier.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback regarding your recent stay. We apologize that you felt that our associates were not helpful in looking for your lost credit card. Upon your initial request via phone, the Bistro staff searched for your credit card and did not find it. The following day, when you physically came to the hotel, the staff made another effort to locate your lost property. The search included moving the table and chairs in the bistro area and found nothing. As it turns out, your credit card was found in your room under the bed after housekeeping was requested to strip the room apart for a second look. Once your card was located by the housekeeper, you were immediately notified that we had found it. Our team made an effort in locating your lost and found item. It is unfortunate that it did not meet your expectations. Again, we apologize if you felt that we were unhelpful during the whole process.  Sincerely, Joy

Summary: This little hotel was great for our purpose.  We needed a quiet safe place to stay near SNA.  The room was clean and cheap and very quiet.  the surrounding area is a business park so the evening traffic was minimal and it was easy to find.  FREE PARKING - most the hotels we looked at had outrageous parking prices.

Location was ok, breakfast expensive, bier expensive, gym from the 80's and the pool was cold. Rooms where a bit old but clean.  The icemachine outside my room was way to loud. It was a short drive to shopping and beaches.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying at the Courtyard South Coast Metro and for sharing your feedback with us. I am sorry to hear that the pool was cold and the ice machine was too loud. I will share this with our Engineering department to ensure that the pool water temperature is being monitored and the ice machines are turned off at night so they do not disrupt our guests' sleep.  We hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to Santa Ana.  Sincerely, Joy

Summary: This Courtyard is very clean and quiet. The location is great; close to John Wayne airport, Newport Beach, and many restaurants. Our room was very comfortable. There is also plenty of free parking around the property. Overall, a great stay!

Odd location in Orange County.. had I known the surrounding area, I probably would have stayed at an alternate property.  The hotel is consistent in quality and service.. served it's purpose for my business trip.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay at the Courtyard South Coast Metro. We hope to host you again in the near future.  Sincerely, Joy

Summary Heading: Great hospitality but room quality lacking
Summary: Pros:  Nikki was very pleasant and got me checked-in to my room in no time. I was able to request a room with a mini fridge during my stay without any issue. Little things like spinning a prize wheel upon check-in to win Marriott points, coffee, sandwich, etc. is a nice bonus that other hotels lacks. (It doesn't cost much but certainly a nice way to break the ice sometime).  The rooms are also equipped with more than enough electric plugs to power my devices. The pull out desk is great for working. Parking is free. Free premium (quick and stable) internet for Marriott Elite members.   Cons:  The elevator is very slow. The room  is a little dated and the walls are very thin.  I stayed during a weekend where there was a concert going on and I could hear people running around and
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with us. My sincere apologies for the issues you experienced during your stay. I have shared your feedback with the appropriate departments to ensure this was an isolated issue.   We hope to see you again next time your travels brings you back to Santa Ana.  Sincerely, Joy

Summary: My friend and I stayed here for a concert we attended at the Constellation Room.  I love that it was walking distance from the venue and it was the nicest hotel around.  Though there isn't much to do around the area.

This is a clean spacious hotel with remodeled lobby and rooms, but it is still an older hotel.  The room is big and I like the California King Size bed with plenty of room to stretch out.  Both sides of the bed are equipped with electrical outlets which is convenient.  My room had a pull out bed built into the couch.  It also had a small balcony that overlooked the courtyard and pool.    The desk is extra spacious with plenty of room to spread out and work.   Multiple AC outlets are available in the lamp to connect your devices.The free wifi is zippy and had decent download speeds.  It is the typical Marriott wifi setup and authentication.    The TV multimedia outlets are accessible to plugin your own media.  HDMI, RCA, and USB are all available on the LG 40in screen.    The

Summary Heading: Not bad but it could be better
Summary: I stayed 5 days , the location of the hotel is very good as it is 5 miles from Newport, 6 miles from Huntington Beach, 5 miles from Anahiem conference center, 5 minutes from the wander full south cost plaza .. The room is standees nothing special. I was suppose that the breakfast and coffee is not for free. Last year I stayed in courtyard hotel and I remember that the breakfast and coffee was completely. I stayed after that at the Hilton Huntington Beach which is better than this hotel with only extra $40 per night. The room rate is expensive for what you get.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, We are glad to hear that you like our proximity to the beaches, Anaheim Convention Center and South Coast Plaza. I apologize If you were under the assumption that our hotel offered complimentary breakfast. In order to remain competitive and offer the best rate, the hotel does not have breakfast included. Like most Courtyards, we have a Bistro, which is open for breakfast and dinner for guests that would like to have the convenience of onsite food service. We hope to see you again when your travel brings you back to the area.  Sincerely, Joy

Summary: Room and facilities as advertised. Pool is a nice refreshing dip after a day indoors at an office. Location is good lots of nice local restaurants very close, you could even walk (< mile away). Will put this on my to return to list if Im in the area again.

We stayed here 4 nights, paid top price for a suite.  The suite was very nice, clean and the courtyard and pool was nice.  Unfortunately our suite was right next to the courtyard sitting area so we had to wear earplugs to sleep because people were out late at night partying.  There were LOTS of kids roaming the halls and making noise at night and in the courtyard area.  Our first night there our kids went to enjoy the pool and a group of kids that were there for a soccer tournament started throwing food at them...so our kids did not want to hang out in the courtyard area after that.  Unfortunately, if your looking for a quiet hotel, this is not the one.  It is beautifully decorated, the staff was really great and the maid service was wonderful.  We did complain about the noise
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  My sincere apology for the noise your experienced during your recent stay with us.  We do in fact have a sports team in house.  We do everything we can to eliminate all noise unfortunately it still impacted your stay.  This is not typical of our hotel and I hope you give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Sincerely,

Summary: We visited while in the area on a combined family and work trip.  The hotel was well located and easy to find.  If you come in late, you may have difficulty with parking, but the surface lot was very convenient.  The staff was very welcoming and quickly provided us with room keys and information on breakfast, hotel amenities, etc.  Our room was large and clean.  If in the area, we would stay here again.

This was as close to Newport as we could get. Having stayed often in marriotts I was disappointed with this one. Our room was on the road side and the noise was unbelievable. We were woken up before 6am with traffic noise. Also the wifi didn't work. Even when we upgraded to the $5/day, we didn't have a connection unless we were in the lobby.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  It appears from your feedback that there were a few challenges during your stay with Internet performance and noise. we certainly understand how important Internet performance is to ensuring an enjoyable stay, whether it’s to stay connected with colleagues during business travel or with family and friends during leisure adventures. I truly apologize that the service was not fully functional during your stay and for experiencing street noise. I, along with all other hotel associates, are passionate about offering the best possible experience to all of our guests and are subsequently looking into ways to improve the reliability of our Internet service.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary: Asked for quiet room and got one.  Unfortunately, the family (or families) next to and across the hall were terrible.  Kids running, yelling, crying and no parents to be found.  Dealt with it for a couple hours since it was early evening.  But I was concerned their behavior would continue late into night.  I called the front desk and spoke to Rafael.  Said no problem and would bring me the keys to new room.  He was there within 10 minutes!  Lifesaver, as I got a very quiet room and slept well.  Hotel is clean, plenty of parking and a good location for me, as I attended concert withing walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your great feedback.  I am happy to hear the hotel was the right fit for your needs.  The team enjoyed making your stay memorable and we hope to see you again in the near future.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary Heading: Another visit and theThe place was clean and the people were friendly.
Summary: We stayed here for three night The parking was widely available when we got there, The room was roomy and clean, the bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and clean.  The people in main lobby was a very pleasant We would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good location, but too noisy for me
Summary: I like Courtyards and I wanted to like this one more than I did.  I stayed three nights.  Pros: courteous staff, plenty of parking, good location (at least for me) and a nice lobby.  In fact, my friend and I spent time in the living room area of the lobby where it was relaxing.  The sleeping room has a huge desk with an office chair.  I also appreciated a solid door to the bathroom.  Good options for sockets to charge electronics without having to use sockets along the floor as in some hotels.  Cons: the mattress was not up to Marriott/Courtyard standards.  The air-conditioner was so loud that even earplugs did little to allow me a decent night's sleep, and I was there during hot, humid days so air-conditioning was necessary.  The smoke detector has a small light that
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Courtyard Costa Mesa South Coast Metro with us.  Every process put in place is aimed at providing you with an unforgettable hotel experience. From your recent feedback, I am disappointed to learn that we fell short of your expectations.  I would like to take this time to apologize for the noise disturbance caused by the guests above you. Rest assured, we are taking steps to help ensure problems of this nature do not occur in the future.   Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to serve you again whenever your travels bring you back to Santa Ana.  Sincerely, Donia Benali

Summary: Not the best Courtyard, but the location and price were right.  Bistro bar is one of the better ones, with really nice staff.  Rooms are ok, nicer ones face the courtyard and overlook the pool.  Elevators are really slow.  This is a major problem in the morning when they are all jammed with housekeeping staff and their carts.  Try a lower floor and use the stairs, but tat is a pain when you have rolling bags.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding our hotel. We appreciate you bringing the elevator speed to our attention, we will ensure the matter is resolved as soon as possible.  We are happy to hear the team and our food and beverage offerings exceeded your expectations.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary: My son and his team stayed here recently for a soccer tournament taking place at UC Irvine. This hotel was easily $50 less than the hotels we found within 3 miles of the college. It sits 6 miles away, but it is an easy freeway ride to the school if you are visiting, and has free parking which many closer hotels charge for. Just take the 73S, and exit before the first toll exit. You don't need a pass or pay a fee, as long as you exit before the toll road begins.    The hotel itself was comfortable but not fancy, with a nice pool/outdoor courtyard perfect for the kids to run around and play in. There is a good gym, and a very nice lobby with a cafe and lots of seating. There is a kids menu on request, so be sure to ask. The breakfast actually cost less than the I-Hop we ended up

Summary Heading: Nice property, kind of in the middle of nowhere!
Summary: Usually stay at the Costa Mesa Marriott, but was looking for something a bit more budget conscious. Nice enough property, seems a little older, and could use a freshening. Not much around it, as it is really in Santa Ana, not Costa Mesa.  Quick two night stay, no problems, could have really used a room not facing a main thoroughfare.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with us.  We are located in a business district however South Coast Plaza is located only 5 miles away and Disneyland 9 miles away.  Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during your past stay, I hope you will consider the South Coast Metro Courtyard on your next visit to Orange County so that we can better deliver upon the guest experience you deserve.  Donia  General Manager

Summary: I recently had the pleasure of staying in the Courtyard Marriot.  I went to another location right before & wasn’t treated very nicely (9950 Slater Avenue location)….so when I encountered Rafael, it was a very nice surprise.  He hooked me up with a very nice room, last minute with no reservation.   I get to my room.  I inspect it immediately….I only saw a little hair in the tub that wasn’t mine.  Other than that, the room was very clean.  I slept wonderfully.  My bed was comfy.  There were a lot of fluffy pillows, my bedding was clean.  The bathroom was nice.  I had a little trial figuring out how to turn on the light (I had never seen those fixtures) but once I could see in the bathroom, it was all good!   Flat screen TV….check!  Wi-Fi…..check!! I had a view of the balcony.  It
Manager Response: Dear  Guest, Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with us.  As the cleanliness of our hotel is a key priority, I am very sorry that your guestroom fell short of your expectations. Please rest assured that your comments have been shared with the housekeeping team in an effort to improve our service.  I am pleased to hear you found our staff friendly and you enjoyed our internet and flat screen TV's.  We hope you choose us again on your next visit to California.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary: As a Platinum Elite / Platinum for Life Member with Marriott, I can say that this property carries the Courtyard Banner very well. This is a nicely updated old fashioned courtyard with plenty of balcony and walk-out rooms. I really like the lay-out.  The property itself is well maintained and probably is a "4 rated property", but the staff makes this property a "5" in my book... super friendly and professional, from the arrival experience through my entire 3 night stay... just superb. The overnight front desk lady (Donna) was even kind enough to get me my coffee before the bistro opened in the morning... a welcome and appreciated gesture for an East Coast Time Zone guy!  The property itself is in a good location, within 5 minutes drive of most any type of restaurant you could
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience at our hotel the South Coast Metro Courtyard. As a valued Platinum Elite Rewards member , we appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear that you had a great stay.
