With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations. Your feedback is integral to our ability to continue to improve our service. Thank you again for your time and come visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Donia Benali General Manager

Summary: I stayed here for one night whilst in town to see a concert at the Observatory (just a few blocks away). We had 2 rooms total.  We arrived early and enquired about checking in prior to the standard time of 3pm. The receptionist was really helpful and allowed us to check in just after 12pm, and managed to put our rooms next to each other which was awesome.  The parking was widely available when we got there, but when we went out and came back later that evening, it got really full. We did find a space after driving around the hotel to the back. This was not a huge problem for us though, just worth a mention.  The room was roomy and clean, the bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and clean. The room also had an iron and ironing board which was great.  The main
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the South Coast Metro Courtyard.  With a mission to provide superior customer service, we take great pride in serving your needs and are delighted to hear that we have met your expectations.  Your feedback will be shared with the team to continue to inspire and motivate them to deliver exceptional customer service. Thank you for staying with us, we hope you choose to stay with us again whenever your travel needs bring you back to Santa Ana.  Sincerely, Donia Benali General Manager

Summary Heading: We got to spin a "Wheel of Fortune" thing at check-in!
Summary: I love when you get to be pleasantly surprised checking into hotels.  As platinum members, we were upgraded to a suite, always a plus, plus they had this wheel thing and we earned more bonus points.  Front desk staff was super friendly too.  Bed was super comfortable, and it was nice having a separate room with a couch to work on in the morning.  The only complaint was the constant flashing of the fire alarm in front of the bed that woke up both my husband and I several times through the night.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for sharing your experience at the South Coast Metro Courtyard.  As a valued Platinum member, I appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear that you had a great stay. With a spirit to serve, we take great pride in not only meeting, but exceeding your expectations.  I have also shared your feedback concerning the flashing light and I will make sure it is corrected in the future. Your feedback is integral to our ability to continue to improve our service. Thank you again for your time and come visit us again soon!  Sincerely,  Donia General Manager

Summary: I am not a demanding traveler. I expect cleanliness, reasonable comfort, simple but pleasing decor, and easy access to simple foods. On the other hand, I am also a demading traveler in that I seek openable windows or balcony doors, and siting such that I can leave the curtains open and wake up to sky and (ideally) treetops. And in a new geography (which this was for me) I care about the complexity of the route from/to the airport, and the traffic patterns at the hotel entry. All good at this property. And the pluses included an elegant bathroom (with near-instant hot water), a convenient interior stairwell and an unusually appealing pool. [I rarely use hotel pools. And I didn't have the time to try this one. But it was tempting.] The hotels near the airport would have been
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to rate your recent stay with us here at the Courtyard Costa Mesa South Coast Metro.  We are looking forward to exceeding your expectations again whenever your travels bring you back to Santa Ana.   Sincerely, Donia General Manager

Summary: I'm a creature of habit, as I think most road warriors are that frequently travel to the same places.  I'm also a Marriott Platinum so I expect a lot better from this brand.    My big general complaint continues to be the "Bistro" concept at Courtyards.  The food is just not that good and too expensive.  Overall room cleanliness was good; the front desk staff was friendly,  But the property in general is really getting long in the tooth.  First, this property is surrounded by office buildings.  There are no real restaurants within a mile or so.    I arrived late and just didn't want to drive somewhere so, against my better judgement and past experience, I decided I would try the always-too-expensive-for-the-quality bistro.  The special was ribs, not what I really wanted but I
Manager Response: Dear Guest, Thank you for taking the time to complete the Guest Satisfaction Survey in regards to your recent stay at the South Coast Metro Courtyard. As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept my sincere apology for our Bistro menu not meeting your expectations. We introduce new menu items 4 times a year in hopes to keep it fresh and up to date. Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Santa Ana.  Sincerely, Donia Tepper General Manager

Summary: Location:  It is in the middle of nowhere in Costa Mesa.  On a Thursday, it was sparsely populated so plenty of space for parking.  Lobby:  Nice spacious lobby.  Typical Courtyard vending store.  Looked like a nice bar/food counter for breakfast and light dinner.  Rooms:  OK.  Lots of towels but just one itty-bitty piece of soap, so you have to carry it from the sink to the shower and back! Lots of outlets for plugging in stuff.  The bed seemed fine but I got up with a very sore back, so not sure what was wrong.  Gym & Pool:  Decent gym, and there was no one else there in the afternoon.  Nice pool, although no one was swimming.  The thermostat in the gym did not work, but the weather was nice, so could prop open the door.  The TVs in the gym need work.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to give us your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. In reading your review it sounds like you were missing a bar of soap in your guestroom and the gym was not at a comfortable enough temperature for your enjoyment. A quick call to the front desk would have allowed us to deliver any amenities you may have needed as well as dispatching a staff member to the fitness room. We pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during our guest's travels and we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. We sincerely apologize for the issues you experienced. I can assure you that this was an isolated incident and that it has been corrected moving forward. In upholding our commitment to providing a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Costa Mesa.  Sincerely,  Alisa F

Summary: Wonderful place to stay. Personell upon check in was very friendly and helpful. Nice lobby area with a little 'market place'. Our room was quite spacious, with a little couch to sit on. Comfortable bed and shower. Conveniently located (you will need a car, though) close to South Coast Plaza and Newport Beach and beyond. Wifi in the room is of excellent quality. Nice hotel, would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your great feedback, we are so happy you enjoyed your recent stay with us.  We look forward to having you back hopefully in the very near future.  Sincerely,  Donia

Summary Heading: Great service - Will Stay Here Again
Summary: We recently stayed here for 3 nights. The location on Harbor Blvd. gives good access to eateries. It is about 10-15 minutes north of Newport and Huntington Beaches.  There is a restaurant in the hotel and there is a small convenience cubby which sells drinks, food - and the food prepared fresh!  The room was clear, the bed was comfortable - the linens were fresh and clean which was nice. The few staff members that we interacted with were helpful - include a flat screen tv and a tub. People at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful. He represented the hotel well.    Ask for a high floor, away from the elevators, an inside room to avoid highway noise - facing the pool.  We would definitely recommend this for business and vacation travelers!!!.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am so pleased you enjoyed your recent stay wth us, we are looking forward to exceeding your expectations on your next visit.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary: The hotel has a lot of courtyard space for big family to hang out. Lovely setting at the lobby with more hangout space/TV. Rooms are spacious snd very clean. Cafe staff were very helpful. They let me buy a cup of tea after closing through the front desk cashier. I was pleasantly surprise. They even let me extend my check out for an extra hour without giving me a hard time. I had a peaceful and relaxing weekend here. Will certainly come back again.

Me and my *now* husband have stayed here 3 times in the last year and are staying again on our Christmas trip to Disneyland. We love this place. The first time we stayed was in January and was for a concert at the Constellation Room, which is right down the street! We were able to stay out and party all night long and walk back without having to worry about parking our car. The night auditor on staff was really friendly and chatted with us a bit about the show as we bought some snacks from their little vending area. The next 2 times were both for Disneyland trips. Disney is fairly close (5 to 10 minutes driving) and I am much more willing to save big on the hotel room and pay for parking than to pay the crazy hotel prices right next to the park and be able to walk. One of those
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am so pleased to hear you have been enjoying your stay with us.  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback and we are looking forward to your next scheduled visit.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary Heading: Clean, friendly staff, great for price
Summary: Staff was very friendly, room and property were clean. Toilet in room was slow to flush (you had to hold the flush handle down for 5-10 seconds), but everything else was great. Great value for the price. I made the mistake of booking a non-marriott hotel my last trip to California. Was refreshing to be back at a quality hotel.

This hotel was super convenient for my work trip and my early AM trip to Newport Beach . It's modern and nice but I had to document a few issues.   1- room had a funny odor like urine but could've been the cleaner used 2- I had left a clean room and returned to new towels and a un flushed "used" toilet 3. I was on the ground floor directly next to the exterior door which seems to be a perk for ease of coming and going but was anything but when I was up all night as guest would come and go and I heard each one like they were in my bed! 4. Front desk was not able to check me out because my flight was early ( had to leave at 330 am) but advertised 24 hours  Breakfast was awesome and starbucks coffee in house was great . Also can't stress enough that the locations was great !!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us.  As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the three issues you experienced. I can assure you that this was an isolated issue and that it has been corrected moving forward.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Costa Mesa.  Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: This is a convenient hotel that is great for the business professional that likes straight forward, clean and cost effective lodging for a business trip.  Their lobby is updated and access to the hotel is easy just off the 405 freeway.  My only complaint from my recent stay was that the cnn channel on the tv did not work.  I called the front desk and received a less than eager response from someone at the front desk.  The TV's in the rooms are very nice, but without cnn it does me no good!  At the same time, I would say that the front desk staff when I checked in was really great.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to  provide us your feedback.  My sincere apologies for your preferred channel not working and most of all for the associate response you received.  I can assure you that it is not indicative of the standards we have set and strive to maintain.  I have addressed your concerns with the team and corrective measures have been put in place to ensure this does not happen in the future.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary: Stayed here for a business trip. Centrally located to Fountain Valley. Close to John Wayne Airport. Rooms are clean. Exercise room is top notch. Service was excellent. Free Wi-Fi and parking. Even the food at the bistro was good. Would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for visiting our hotel and for your great feedback.  We are looking forward to your return hopefully in the near future.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary Heading: Will Stay Here Again I'm Sure
Summary: Having stayed here previously in the past, it was nice to come back to this particular Courtyard. Here are the positives: 1) It was conveniently located to all my son's soccer games, 2) The Bistro is great & convenient for grabbing good food (& Starbucks) on the go, 3) The outdoor pool/lounge area is nice (our team ordered Maggiano's takeout and ate family-style in the spacious outdoor seating), 4) Free parking and Wi-fi, 5) Hotel staff is courteous and extra friendly. Also, we got to the hotel at 12:00 p.m. asking, but not expecting an early check in. They were able to accommodate us right away. I know this does not happen all the time, so we were especially appreciative as my son was able to rest in between his games.  Here's the bad: 1) There's no Jacuzzi at the pool. I
Manager Response: Dear guest,  I am so pleased you enjoyed your stay with us!  It is our goal to exceed our guests expectations and it is feedback like yours that allows us that opportunity.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary: I am used to finding Courtyard hotel product as a nice alternative to other hotels.  This particular hotel appears to have been some kind of conversion/renovation, and it shows as a relatively "tired" hotel product.  This is a large hotel and the lobby is somewhat difficult to locate from the street frontage.  There is a large, open reception area that is combined with the community "open space"/breakfast area.  Due to the overall size of the hotel and it's low-rise design, the rooms are spread out in a somewhat confusing manner, in other words, you basically have to drive all the way around the hotel to try to find the closest secured entry to get to your room.  Similarly, the elevators are not marked, so you get to hunt and peck looking for them, or you can lug your suitcase
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at our hotel.  I apologize you felt  the hotel was difficult to navigate we are committed to providing more specific direction.  Our public space was renovated in 2012, guest rooms were renovated in 2013 and a brand new fitness room was built the beginning of 2014.  I can assure your experience is not indicative of the service we have set and strive to maintain.  I hope you give us an opportunity in the future to better meet your needs.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary: I recently stayed here for 4 nights over 2 separate stays.  Ask for an inside room to avoid highway noise.  Very comfortable beds, and an excellent shower experience.  Most of the staff, especially the guy at the front desk whose name begins with "R," are very pleasant.  He is an awesome customer service rep.  The only negative was that one day our room wasn't cleaned until 4:30 PM, and the next day until 5:15 PM.  This cut into our getting ready for the evening.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are so pleased you enjoyed your stay!  I have shared your comments with our housekeeing team and I can assure a system has been in place in order for your room to be serviced prior to 4PM moving forward.  Thank you for your feedback and I hope you stay with us again very soon.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary: We stayed here on our family vacation. It was very clean. I had a quiet room with a balcony. It does come with a coffee maker or you can go downstairs and get a Starbucks ( which i personally thought was awesome). The staff respected my things when they came in and cleaned. Loved that they had the idea of a pull out couch however my boys complained in wasn't very comfortable and one even slept on the floor to avoid it. The front desk made a very quick check in check out. Oh and I have to say we love swimming in the salt water pool. Soft water.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you so much for taking the time to rate your recent stay with us at the South Coast Metro Courtyard.  I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay despite the sofa bed discomfort.  Feedback like yours is what allows us to continue improving and exceeding guest expectations.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary: We appreciate the clean hotel, and friendly staff at this Courtyard.   The pool is salt water, and was clean and enjoyable.   This hotel is located close to the airport, but charged less reward points than the Courtyard that is right by the airport.
Manager Response: Hi Christine,  I am so happy you enjoyed your stay with us!  Thank you so much for the nice comments, we are looking forward to your next visit hopefully very soon.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary: Really More Like a 3.5 but the extra because the staff was very friendly and helpful. The location on Harbor Blvd. gives good access to eateries (mostly fast food and family style). The grounds are well kept and there is a nice pool but no Jacuzzi.  There is a restaurant in the hotel and there is a small convenience cubby which sells drinks, food (with a microwave) and travel items you may have forgotten.    The rooms are spacious and include a flat screen tv and a tub.  There are balconies that overlook Harbor Blvd and have chairs and a table if you want to sip coffee or tea. There is a small fridge but no safe.  There are two glass doors and screen door in between.  It keeps the busy traffic noise at bay.  The same can't be said for the doors to the hallway.  Don't know if
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review our hotel.  It is feedback like yours that allows us to meet our guest expecations and ensure all their needs are met.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary: Clean and modern this property was convenient and at $85 on priceline a good deal. Comfortable bed. Only problem while "sleep walking" slammed my toe into the couch which is close to the bed! Recommended.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you so much for taking the time to rate our hotel!  I am glad you enjoyed your stay despite stubbing your toe while sleep walking.  We hope you visit us again very soon.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary Heading: Could be a 4 for location of near by businesses, however price high
Summary: Business trip brought me here... a decent location related to other nearby hotels, and close to the business park. Hotel is clean, staff is nice, however no restaurant on site for supper... just a small counter type grill for simple sandwiches, etc..  The only real downfall is the price is too high for this hotel (Avg. 119-189).. this place in comparison is about a 99.-129 type hotel. Caters to business in the area and a better option than say the vagabond and quality in down the block.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for choosing the South Coast Metro Courtyard for your recent stay.  I appreciate you taking the ime to rate us and provide us with feedback.  It is feedback like yours that allows us to imprve our hotel to better meet our guest expectations.  Sincerel, Donia

Summary: Average Courtyard, located near my meetings.  The problem with the hotel was the very noisy street which was horrible for getting any rest.  Traffic was very loud and it was difficult to sleep. Staff was ok.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  My sincere apologies for the noise you experienced during your recent stay with us.  I am excited to share with you that we have a project taking place this year to reinforce the windows facing our Harbor side rooms.  I am confident this will have a great impact on our guest experience.  I hope you give us another opportunity to exceed your expectations.  Sincerely,  Donia Benali

Summary Heading: Horrible to have guest rooms near a lobby when they know they have a wedding reception
Summary: The point of a hotel is a place to sleep. Yet knowing they had a wedding reception booked for their lobby, they gave us (non wedding guests) the room closest to the lobby. Guess how much sleep I got? And all the manager said was "they are winding down" as people are yelling and screaming and I still not asleep. Awful!
Manager Response: Dear guest,  My sincere apologies for the noise you experienced!  We were unfortunately not aware of the wedding parties intent to gather in our lobby and I can certainly understand how frustrating the experience must have been.  We are in communication with the involved party to express our concerns with what took place.  I can assure this is not indicative of the service we strive to provide and I hope you give us another opportunity to better serve you in the future.  Sincerely,  Donia Benali

Summary: Four of us stayed here for a show we were attending in Anaheim. We normally stay in full service Marriott's but this one had good reviews and very attractive rates. The hotel is a typical Courtyard very up-to-date and very well kept. The rooms are nice and clean. I asked to not be on the ground floor and fact busy street was not a problem. I travel on a regular basis throughout the country and have to stay the staff was terrific. Very friendly and very helpful they actually recommended some terrific restaurants nothing touristy and followed up after to get our thoughts. The man who works at the Starbucks/restaurant was above and beyond friendly. If you want to save some $$ try this property but keep in mind nothing in walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear guest,  Thank you so much for taking the time to comment on your recent stay with us.  I am delighted to hear you had a great experience and I hope you will visit again in the near future.  Sincerely,  Donia Benali

Summary: The hotel is a common Courtyard. Nothing to write home about but nothing to slam them on either. The staff was very nice and helpful, so 5 starts to staff. The room is of good size and though my room faced the busy street, I did not experience noise. The bed was comfortable and the shower was good. The small but useful business center in the lobby was well kept. Housekeeping didn't show, so I had to call the front desk to have room serviced late in the day. But who knows, maybe they had a off day or short help.  The location of the hotel is so-so. It is easy to get to highway 405 but otherwise not much else that peaks interest. The price was good for the type of hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback, it is feedback like yours that allows us to continue improving the hotel.  Thank you for rating the team 5 star!  I have addressed the housekeeping peace and I am confident we will exceeed your expectations on your next visit.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary: The room was clear, the bed was comfortable, and the few staff members that I interacted with were helpful.  My stay was a quick business trip: I arrived late in the day, slept, had a small breakfast at the coffee shop in the lobby (I Starbucks if I remember correctly), and left early the next morning.  Nothing was "WOW," but that's not what I was looking for.  I wanted quick and easy, and that's what it was.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share your feedback.  I am glad you enjoyed your stay and I am confident we will be able to deliver the "WOW" factor on your next visit.  Sincerely, Donia

Summary: It's a fairly typical Courtyard. No deal breaker problems, but not stellar either. Fine for all practical purposes.  Usually there is a small mini fridge in rooms at Courtyards, not in my room here. The room had a little bit of an old,  dank smell. Not oppressive but certainly not great.   Staff was nice and professional.  Especially housekeeping,  My room was missing a luggage stand, when I tried calling the front desk twice with no answer either time. I walked out into the hallway and the housekeeper busy cleaning a room,  found an extra one in a room and gave it to me.   (you can judge for yourself about them not answering the front desk phone at 3:30 in the afternoon on a Tuesday, I let it ring at least 8 times each attempt). Not very pleased that they've removed the

Summary Heading: Very nice place to stay in!
Summary: Good location, great prices and friendly staff. The coffee/breakfast bar is awesome with very friendly staff. The only annoying thing (which probably applies to all hotels) is the their overpriced items at the 24 hour market. I took a bottle of water and nyquil and I got slapped with a $12 charge.   Would stay there again!

Nice hotel relatively close to the freeway. Got a great same day rate after arriving in the OC.  The room was well appointed, the hotel had a nice pool area and the hotel seemed really quiet while we were there, which was excellent.  Staff who assisted us during check in and checkout were very pleasant to deal with. If we're in the area in the future, we would stay again.

I'll start by saying this was the best outdoor pool setup I've seen!  The actual courtyard and pool area are awesome- the pool is huge and the hot tub is lovely and located in a very nice gazebo.  The bistro was good as usual (fee for breakfast like all Courtyards).  The rooms need some refreshment- a little cramped and they feel a little on the old side.  Overall, not a bad property but there is some room to improve.

We booked this hotel for a concert in LA,preferring to stay in Orange County.I  always try to book a Marriott as they rarely disappoint,and this one was no exception.Very nice ,very clean,great staff and good parking.As usual we prefer a top floor and we stayed on the fourth floor.The area was a little industrial which means it was very quiet at night,even daytime wasn't very noisy.We would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Improved since some earlier lower ratings
Summary: I think this is a solid 4 out of 5 - not sure what the issues were from earlier lower ratings but I guess some things were improved.  Location is great, just off the beaten path from the hectic South Coast Plaza area but still close enough to be convenient.  Right on the border of Costa Mesa and Santa Ana, but feels relatively safe being surround by mostly corporate buildings.  A good value for the price.  The guy at the front desk was efficient and polite.  Lobby area had free popcorn and free iced cucumber water available near the Bistro which is a nice touch.  I think a lot of people requested upper level rooms away from the elevators, since a whole bunch of guests were jam packed into my end of the floor, and the hotel couldn't have been more than 1/4 occupied.  Due to poor

I stayed here two nights for business and I wish I would have stayed another 5 nights. This hotel is very clean and the staff are friendly. Staff memeber named Ho was very helpful with checking in. I would definitely recommend this for business and vacationing travelers. It's very close to Disney and Knotts. Also it is about 10-15 minutess north of Newport and Huntington Beaches.

While off the beaten track a bit, this Courtyard is not a disappointment.  The rooms were clean and the staff was super friendly.  Even the the little Bistro downstairs was clean and the food prepared fresh!

We were going to Pagent of the Masters, and stayed here because of convenience and price.  The rooms were clean, good size and comfortable.  It was easy access to the freeway.  The area was quiet, but there were plenty of restaurants nearby.  We went up to Downtown Disney one morning and that was an easy drive.  Would consider staying there on my next trip to Disneyland.  And Jared at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful.  He represented the hotel well.

I gave my daughter a gift of a night at this hotel while she was attending a wedding.  It was freshly decorated, new lobby, and best of all, a very friendly staff.  The  staff went out of their way to provide a nice experience for this visit.

Our group stayed here because the US surf competition kept us out of Huntington Beach. It was close to Huntington Beach, Newport Beach and LA. The rooms were clean and the service was usually very good. Maid service was good, but they often didn't show up until after 3 pm. It seems like they have too much work to do. We requested a refrigerator and microwave. We never got the microwave, but there was one available in the lobby 24/7. Parking was free and the pool was great. We also enjoyed the balcony, although we did not have chair for the first couple days of the trip. I would stay here again. Hint: ask for a refrigerator before you arrive.

Summary Heading: Nice place, middle of commercial area
Summary: Arrived about 1pm and was greated by an unfriendly clerk. She snickered when I asked if it was possible to check in. She said "check in is at 3" and stared me down. Not a good way to start. Drove about 5 miles to South Coast Plaza (thinking this place was near the South Coast Plaza as in the name) for lunch. Upon returning at 3:05 expecting the same wicked witch, I was pleasantly surprised to be greeted by Amanda. She got me to an upgraded room, pool view (larger 2 Q room over smaller 2 double bed room) and set the stay off right.   Room was clean and updated. Pool as well. Spa was closed for repairs, appears to be permanent or at least for a long period of time. FYI.  Wouldnt stay here again, too far from the beach, mall or anything else without driving a ways. But the
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   I want to sincerely apologize for the service you received upon your initial arrival to the hotel. I do appreciate you giving us feedback so that we may address this with our staff.   We are glad to hear that Amanda created a warm check-in experience and that the room exceeded your expectations. You are correct to state that the spa has been closed permanently, as we are repurposing it into a new workout room.  Thank you for taking time to review our property!  Sincerely,  Mikaela

Summary: Everyone is so polite at this hotel. Excellent service from the bistro as well as the manager on duty to make sure everything was to my needs. My room was updated with the latest Courtyard facade so felt new and was clean. I was hoping my Platinum status would have gotten me a room over the pool instead of noisy Harbor Blvd but I was too tired to complain. I just turned on the fan and drowned out the road noise. I also had a room on ground floor and my reservation asked for high floor.  Overall though, I will definitely stay here again. Good location next to the 405 freeway.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for the generous review. We are extremely pleased to hear that the staff was able to create an enjoyable experience for you. I apologize for the discrepency between your request and your placement in the hotel. This is helpful feedback to share with our staff.  We would love to have you back with us upon your next visit to the area.  Sincerely, Mikaela

Summary: Let me start with the pros:  -Nice room decor. -Excellent, polite service at the front desk from Jared.  Now the cons:  -Too much noise from busy Harbor Blvd...not relaxing to listen to traffic all day and night. -TV placed to the SIDE of the bed, rather than at the foot. Very awkward angle on the neck!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We appreciate your feedback, and are thrilled to hear you enjoyed the service. Due to your reviews such as yours we are able to better understand the functionality of the rooms.   We hope to have you back at the hotel in the near future!  Sincerely, Mikaela

Summary: I really like this hotel. The front desk staff are very knowledgable about directions and made me feel like family. The rooms and hotel have recently been renovated and everything in the room was new. I liked having a balcony.They don't have a free breakfast but the restaurant serves the best breakfast it is better than getting the same boring buffet breakfast. It would be nice if they would have coffee in the lobby. The hotel is 5 minutes from the John Wayne airport and 10 minutes from the Huntington Beach Pier. I stayed here 12 days for business and definitely will go back.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I really appreciate you taking the time to write a review, and thank you for your kind words. We are thrilled that you were pleased with our newly renovated rooms and were able to enjoy the Bistro.  We cannot wait to have you back! Hopefully next time it will be a leisurely trip instead of all business :)  Thank you! Mikaela

Summary: We chose this hotel because it was convenient to our morning appointment in Tustin. It was a good choice as the hotel was off the beaten path a little but easy to find with GPS. It had an attractive appearance outside and a nice décor in the lobby area. The grounds were also very attractive. The check-in experience was easy and efficient. The rooms were well maintained, comfortable and spacious. The bed was comfortable and enabled a good night's sleep. The WiFi worked well during our stay. The Bistro in the morning was a nice option for breakfast as the prices were reasonable with some good, healthy choices. The checkout was also very efficient. The rates were pretty good for the area. I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing a hotel in this area.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We are sincerely happy to hear that not only was our close proximity to your appointment ideal, but that our staff and amenities met your needs and expectations so well.  Your lovely review is very kind and appreciated. We very much hope to see you back the next time you find yourself in the area.  Thank you! Mikaela

Summary: this is a great hotel if you're going to a concert at The Observatory.  it's cross the street so no need to worry about parking or driving afterwards.  However note, that there's not much around as far as nightlife.  The hotel has a nice lounge with beer, wine and some cocktails..  the rooms have been re-done and are more modern.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I appreciate your review. We are so pleased that the proximity to the Observatory worked so well for your stay.   I'm also  very happy you were able to enjoy our Bistro at night.   We would love to have you back if you ever plan on seeing another show or are visiting the area again!  Sincerely, Mikaela

Summary: It is tough to review this hotel. It is in the process of a remodel and so it might be a completely different property in a couple of months.   The lobby area has been remodeled to the new Courtyard standard. So it is nice and modern. The rooms however are being torn apart. My room was fine. Standard Courtyard.  One complaint is that the room's main lights are motion sensored. So they will turn off after a while. I'm all for going green but they are not very sensitive so I had them turning off even when I was in the room.  The pool area looked nice. It is outside and has a nice feel to it. The workout area was pretty poor but I was told it was going to be expanded.   Overall not a bad place, but be prepared for construction. Should be looking good when it is done.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your review! I'm very excited to say that we are now completely finished with our room renovation you noticed was going on during your stay.   Your feedback on the lights shutting off while you were in the room is very helpful to ensure everything is in perfectly working condition.   I am so glad you were able to enjoy our pool area and hopefully we can have you back very soon to enjoy our finished product which will soon include the spa area being turned in to a large workout room as you mentioned.  Thank you! Mikaela

Summary: The updated lobby and bar area are very nice.   The rooms still need updating but will look very nice when they are done.  As someone else said, the towels were fairly worn looking and rough but they soak up water and that is their job afterall.  We slept fairly well but beware, this seems to be a popular place for families going to Disneyland and there was quite a bit of noise starting around 6:30am.  We had the pleasure (note sarcasm) of listening to a husband and wife have a discussion outside our door and frankly it sounded like they were standing in our room, weird accoustics I guess.  We could also hear showers turning on and off from other rooms and the folks above walking around their room was quite loud.  I think next time I will ask for a room on the second floor.  We
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I very much appreciate you taking a moment to review. I am so happy to hear you enjoyed our public areas and that the staff was able to make you feel welcome during your stay.   I am sorry to hear that there was excess noise in the guest room. Feedback such as yours allows us to make improvements necessary for a flawless stay. I assure you this will be something we look in to. I also want to apologize for the inconvenience of not being able to use the spa during your stay. We have plans for repurposing that space and would love to have you back to enjoy that renewed area and our refreshed guest rooms next time you are in town.  Thank you, Mikaela

Summary: Booked this through Priceline and I have used them about 10 times in past and have always been happy with the hotel. Well not this time, traveled with  just my daughter & I and did not feel safe at all. They make the check in area look fresh and up to date, but once you leave that area boy does it change.  The pictures on there website are not true to the room either. Beds are very low to the ground and not comfortable, towels felt rough to touch , like they were well used. I booked and paid for 3 nights at this place & checked out after 12 hrs......
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for your review. I am so sorry to hear that you were unhappy with your recent stay. We are in the process of a room renovation right now that will provide us with brand new beds and a completely refreshed style that compliments our lobby and Bistro. If you are back in the area I would love to be able to show you our improved rooms and hopefully have you stay again.  Sincerely, Mikaela

Summary Heading: Room was fine, but ammenities were lacking
Summary: 1.  Room was very comfortable, but nothing special.  Everything worked and the hotel was very quiet.  We enjoyed our stay and did stay for 4 nights during mid-October.  Shower, TV, small desk and even a small patio overlooking the pool were very nice.  2.  Whirlpool did not work for 4 days.  A sign was posted first two days and we had to tell management it was not working.  Whirlpool is indoors and was hot, but could not be turned on.  This was very disappointing since I am recovering from severe strained leg muscles.  3. Never saw anyone use the outdoor pool.  We tried, but it was ice cold and not heated.  The ocean is only 5 miles away and was warmer than the hotel pool which was unswimmable.  4.  Maid service was dodgy.  We were still in the room until 8:30 AM one morning and
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you so much for your feedback and taking time to write a review. I'm happy to hear that you were pleased with the guest room and location. I want to personally apologize for your stay not being up to the high standard we strive to provide. We appreciate you giving us information that can help us keep our property constantly evolving and improving. If you do plan to make a return trip to the area we would love to have you back so that we may create an experience that will be all around enjoyable.   Sincerely, Mikaela

Summary: This hotel served it's purpose just fine for our stay. We loved the pool chaise lounge chairs with cushions. Hard to come by these days.   Rooms didn't have the most recent package, but they are very clean and well kept.   Thanks for a great stay!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for taking time to write a review! That is wonderful to hear that you were able to utilize our pool area in November and it helped make your stay enjoyable. If there is ever anything I can do to help create the perfect stay please let me know. We'd love to have you back!  Sincerely, Mikaela

Summary: Love this hotel service -so far most friendly staff ever  When we checked in (later than mid night) person in front dest was very welcome us and trying to get better location for us -not near elevator but closed to enterance since we have kids in late time We request roll away bed (we always request when we make regervation ) and this is first hotel that bed show up before us(always ignore our request)  Every staff we met was friendly even people in cafe  Had wonderful new lobby but room was pretty dated -after lobby,welcome to 1980s Had comfortable stay just wish room was up date bit  Closed to Disneyland -about 6 local mile not in best neighbor, freeway was in distance (any freeway) industrial area  We will maybe stay here again if price is right
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking a moment to review our hotel! It's fantastic to hear that you found our staff accommodating and friendly. It's very important to us that each guest feels welcome and appreciated. If you come back to visit the area or Disneyland again we would be so happy to have you stay in one of our newly renovated rooms :)  Sincerely, Mikaela

Summary Heading: Solid Courtyard, locally known as Santa Ana instead of Costa Mesa
Summary: Arrived at SNA airport (the one with the three names: Orange County, John Wayne, Santa Ana) and found this one to be an economical Marriott family choice. The hotel offers no complimentary airport transportation, however Supershuttle ($18+tip, book online with coupon UYR59 to get 15$+tip) got me there after I supplied the exact street address. (Neither their drivers nor their website seems to know this location). The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood, reception was friendly and efficient, in typical Courtyard fashion, breakfast is available for purchase in the restaurant area next to the lobby. Room was spacious, clean, very nice work desk (like the extendable second table), OK work chair (those really should be upgraded to netted kind at some point). Room had sliding doors with
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  We appreciate your review and are so happy to hear that the hotel fit your travel needs. Your feedback on SuperShuttle not having our hotel information was very helpful. We have reached out to them and been added to their website. We are currently in the process of a room renovation that will provide us brand new desk chairs, and we would be thrilled to have you back this year to enjoy the new space.  Sincerely, Mikaela

Summary: A beautiful lobby great little restaurant with really good food.Stayed here 14 days. The front desk staff were so helpful with directions etc.Very cloce to Huntington Beach where I worked and also only a few miles from the South Coast mall. The rooms need a face lift very clean but carpet and furniture seemed old, They said in the fall they are going renovate all the rooms.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for taking the time to review! It is so nice to hear that our front desk staff was able to assist you, and that the location was convenient for work and a little fun. We are in the middle of renovating our rooms and would love to have you back to see the finished product!   Sincerely,  Mikaela

Summary Heading: Excellent Accomodations for My Business Trip
Summary: Well managed, well maintained, clean and comfortable.  I even enjoyed an exceptionally nice whirlpool.  The maid service was prompt and thorough.  The location is a bit odd. Not close to much at al, but that helps keep things quiet.  Closest highway is I-405 so consider that if you use this place for business.  This would actually be a good location for a family trip to Disneyland (less than 10 miles).  I got a really good price on this stay, so my review also reflects my feelings about the deal.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for your great review!  I am so pleased you enjoyed your stay with and that found our service to meet your needs.  We would love to have you back very soon, hopefully this time to visit Disneyland instead of work :)  Sincerely, Donia  Donia Benali General Manager

Summary: Stayed here with a group last summer and had a great stay. The staff was nice and very helpful. Hotel is conviently located near several attractions.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our Courtyard!  I am glad you enjoyed your stay and if there is anyhting we could have done to make your stay more enjoyable please do not hesitate to reach out to me.  I hope you stay with us again this year.  Sincerely, Donia Benali General Manager

Summary: First, one of my huge pet peeves is that even though I indicate at the time of booking I prefer a QUIET Room, NOT near an elevator, no one EVER looks at that at the front desk and puts me in a room near the elevator, and I have to go back to reception and change rooms. I stay at hotels about 50 nights a year. This is the FIRST HOTEL that ever paid heed.  When I arrived Amanda at the front desk looked into my eyes, smiled, and said, "I see you want a quiet room NOT near the elevator and we have one for you".  WOW. Seriously, how many times do you check in and the person barely grunts at you?  Props to Amanda!! We were given a quiet room. Hooray! All the staff we encountered were very present, not just drones. I think they really might like their jobs and want to keep them, as
Manager Response: Dear Elizatbeth,  I am so glad you enjoyed your stay with us and most of all that Amanda was able to accomodate your quiet room request.  It is feedback like yours that allows us to have the right team in place that can best meet your needs.  I hope you visit us again very soon,  Sincerely Donia Benali General Manager

Summary: This is a well run, clean and pleasant Courtyard. The rooms are nicely decorated, comfortable and spacious. The lobby is the usual Courtyard set-up with a bistro, little lounge and business computers. There is free wireless in all rooms. The bistro gets very busy in the morning and there always seems to be a backup. This seems to be a trend at all the Courtyards I have stayed at. It is very puzzling to me why they do not add staff in the morning when business travelers are all in a rush to get going. Overall I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you so much for taking the time to review our Courtyard!  I have reviewed our Bistro staffing model and thanks to your feedback we have added an additional staff member.  I hope you are able to visit us again in the near future so that we can better serve you.  Sincerely, Donia General Manager

Summary Heading: Courtyard is now the place to stay
Summary: While on a trip to Miami a few weeks back, I stumbled upon a cool set up to charge my phone. Little did I know it was a promotional spot to promote the redesigned courtyard. I liked the layout so much I booked my next trip at a courtyard and was happy I did. The costa Mesa location is in an ok spot but has great rooms and services. I get like I was in a much higher scale hotel
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  I am so excited you enjoyed the new lobby design!  Our guest rooms will also be renovated by the end January 2013, I hope you come back for a visit.  Thank you for your feedback,  Donia Benali

Summary: Stayed 5 nights on business and overall thought that it was a comfortable hotel for a good value. Hotel backs to an industrial area, but I found that made for a quiet setting in the evening.  Only a few blocks from 405 so it was in a convenient location for getting around Orange County area at a price less than the hotels around the John Wayne airport.  Ate breakfast in the cafe one morning which was a little pricey, but food was good.  Also ate at a bagel shop and an IHOP for around the same price.  Pool area was clean, as well at the hot tub area (had plenty of clean towels). My room was on the second floor overlooking the pool courtyard.  I a couple of nights were I could hear the couple staying in the room next door and heavy walking in the room above me, but only a few
Manager Response: Thank you so much for reviewing our hotel.  I am glad you found our location to be a plus, we are also only 8 miles away from Disneyland if you would like to stay with us on a leisure trip in the future.  Thank you again for your feedback, we are looking forward to your next visit.  Donia Benali General Manager

Summary: The hotel is very nice and clean with a very attractive lobby and bistro cafe. The guy who checked me in was personable and service was fine, unlike some of the reviews here. Property is clean. The room is attractive, though not quite as much so as the other Courtyard I recently stayed in on MacArthur.   The room was well appointed, and the free wifi had the best speeds of many hotels I've stayed at in the area. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. There was some noise from Harbor Blve as I was staying in an outside-facing room.   Not a whole lot to say, the hotel is quite competent and nice, but I didn't see anything that would put it up to five star rating. The area doesn't seem to be close to anything of great attraction, but if you are here for business it may be a
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to review our hotel.  We appreciate all guest feedback and always strive to provide you the best experience each and every time.

Summary: This is a nice hotel with a really nice lobby.  Pretty close to Disney but far enough away to stay out of the traffic.

While the property itself is fresh and new and kept quite clean, the overall experience wasn't as positive as other experiences I've had with the Courtyard brand.  The staff was lackadaisical and unimpressive.  Our room was not ready upon our arrival, as we'd arrived just after check-in time, I understand this sometimes happens due to late departing guests.  However, the proper solution for this should not have been to offer a room with only one bed, when we'd clearly stated 4 people would be in the room. I found the breakfast cost to be too pricey. I've paid the same at a Marriott in a full-scale restaurant.  The breakfast foods were not bad, nothing spectacular, but certainly not worth the fee being charged.  Our room was clean and offered a nice, but small balcony, though the

Summary Heading: Modern, clean-cut lobby, comfortable rooms,  slow and unenthusiastic service
Summary: We stayed here at the end of the summer. Although we booked a room with a King bed for one night, by the time we arrived we received two queens instead, but the young lady checking us in was very apologetic and nice and we sure were tired. The next morning at about 9.30 we wanted to use the hot tub ( for some reason called spa) to relax our muscles a little before using a pool. Before heading there I checked a few things at the front desk, and extended for another night. He wasn't very friendly. I asked whether there were towels out there to which he said yes. The pool area was thrashed from the night before, pizza boxes, wet towels, beer cans, room service, etc. Nothing was cleaned up, no clean towels in sight. I called the front desk and he said he'd try and call for towels.

Summary Heading: Stayed here when seeing a concert at the Galaxy
Summary: We were looking for a place to stay for a concert at the Galaxy.  The Courtyard was only about 4 blocks up the street so it worked out perfectly for the location.  The hotel?  Absolutely no complaints.  The room was clean, check-in/check-out was flawless, and it was quiet (except for us maybe).  It's in an odd part of town.  Kind of a cross between residential and professional buildings.  But for our purposes, it was the perfect place to stay.  This is a 3-star hotel in a 5-star location (if you're going to see a show at the Galaxy).

Summary Heading: OK place to stay, nice garden & pool area
Summary: Stayed here for 2 weeks during a business trip. The room was clean and standard for a courtyard room. Almost all rooms that are facing the garden & pool area have a balcony with a few chairs and a small table. The pool & garden area is pretty nice with a lounge corner, several sets of chairs/table on the grass, palmtres and some small banana plants. Pool looked ok, was too cold for me to swim. Jazcuzzi is on the side in a covered / semi open area. Disappointing I found that there was no normal restaurant / breakfast buffet in the hotel.. Just a small snackcounter where small snacks at night and some breakfast could be bought. So not included in your room. Free wifi and a modern lobby with a sitting area. The 'gym' consists of 3 machines cramped in a small room. With the 'spa' I

We stayed two nights at this Courtyard as a "base of operations" for our jaunts to Joshua Tree Nat'l Park, Palm Springs, Carlsbad, and the beach.  We received a quiet room on the far side of the hotel.  It was clean, adequately sized for a family of four, and met our needs.  Free wired and wireless high-speed internet was a nice feature, one I've really come to expect these days (and yes, the high-speed internet really was high-speed).  The room was equipped with a large flat-screen TV which was a welcome feature for my teenagers.  I was able to print my flight boarding passes at the hotel's business desk area without issue, and received a complimentary USA Today newspaper.  The only critique I really have of the hotel is with the restaurant/breakfast area.  The menu was

Summary Heading: Comfortable economical stay near industrial area
Summary: The hotel's street address is on Harbor Avenue, one of the main streets immediately adjacent to Disneyland. So I got off of the freeway at Disneyland and followed Harbor Avenue to the hotel, which was some distance. It was actually outside of town, adjacent to an industrial area. This was fine for our purposes, as we stayed for only one night and needed a place to sleep. Because of how the recession has affected the nearby industrial area, Marriott has made it less expensive to stay at this hotel than previously, which is why we tried it. I'd be happy to stay there again next time I'm traveling through Southern California.

Summary Heading: Don't waste your money, there are other Marriott's you can get your points from.
Summary: This Courtyard was shoved in a location that was hard to find. The lobby was old and the rooms were also old, dusty and dirty. It was only a one night stay so I tolerated it. I will not use this hotel ever again.

I arrived at 8am on a Monday and found I was too early for the IBM class I had to take.  Daniel at the front desk allowed me to check in at 8 in the moring!  That completely surprised me.  He continued to provide fantastic service to me for the remainder of the week including remembering my name.  The hotel is very nice and the pool is great.  I enjoyed my stay there.  Comfortable beds, fluffly pillows, etc.  Complaints?  There buffet for $12.95 is a joke.  They serve a great variety of cold eggs and even colder sausage or what appearded to be french toast. I ended up at the IHOP down the street for $7.    The hotel is a bit out of the way, but nothing major.  It's about 3 miles to the major mall and there are great sushi restaurants nearby.  Also try a place across the street

Summary Heading: Nice but could use a little updating
Summary: The room was your normal Courtyard. Just needed a little work. Needed some paint.  It was nice for what we used it for. Ive become used to better from Courtyard.

Summary Heading: Needs some upkeep to keep up with other Courtyards
Summary: First thing I noticed upon entering my room was that it smelled clean. That was great, but I went to close the curtains and the sheer was all frayed, and the blackout curtain behind it had tomato sauce finger prints on it (pizza, anyone?) I looked out the window and the screen was all blotchy and dirty.  We left via a side door when going to dinner, and couldn't help but notice that the tile floor was dirty all along the walls. Bleh. Couldn't help but think after all that, that the place wasn't very clean. Definitely won't stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great overall and nothing to fear
Summary: The staff was helpful on arrival (we asked for directions to a grocery store) and pleasant.  In the morning the server taking care of the breakfast area was very friendly and cheerful.  The breakfast buffet ($12.95) was decent, tasted fine, although nothing overly adventurous or out of the ordinary (scrambled eggs, bacon (done nicely to my liking), sausage (not too greasy which is good), yogurt, fruit, coffee, cereal, toast, bagels, all typical things).  In-room coffee and the coffee at the breakfast area were good as well.  Our room was clean and well laid out and ample size.  Bathroom counter space a little tight though w/the coffeemaker on it (they maybe should stick that on the desk or something in the main bedroom).  The only gripe really is that if you have a room facing

Hotel is well located and rooms are very confortable. If you are looking for a hotel with a good relation between price and quality this hotel is a good option. There is free parking and from hotel you arrive easily to any place in the city and local airport is within 10 minutes.

I found this hotel to offer many ammenities. After a long drive it was a quiet and relaxing place. Although the surrounding area is not the best, they had a nice pool and spa in the courtyard, fitness room, and the room itself was bright and clean.

Stayed here one night.  Hotel is nice and clean.  . Coffee, mini refrigerator in room, free internet. The rate is very reasonable under $100 , good location if you have a car, 5 min to a grocery store, 10 min to South Coast Plaza (Mall).  Our room is kind of noisy (cars from the street), so I slept with my ear plug and the bed linens look very old.

Summary Heading: Clean, decent and reasonably priced alternative to Newport, Ca.
Summary: Instead of staying at the expensive beach cities of Costa Mesa or Newport, try a stay at nearby Santa Ana. This place is clean,large rooms and nice pool.  About 10 minute drive to the beaches at Newport.

Summary Heading: Stay away - Bed bugs in this place
Summary: Spent two night in May 2008. The result - had about 8 bed bugs bites in my body.  Stay away from this place.

My husband and I originally booked a room at the Anaheim Econo Lodge.  After a terrible experience there, we found a room available the next day at the Marriott in Santa Ana.  This was a wonderful hotel.  The rooms were spotless.  The bed was very comfortable.  There was a modern digital thermostat which allowed us to keep the room temperature exactly as we liked.  There was always delicious fresh, free coffee at the check-in desk.  The staff was very friendly.   I can't say enough good things about this hotel.  It was an excellent value for the money.

My husband and I stayed here for one night in December 2007 while attending a concert at the nearby Galaxy Theatre. It's convenient to the 405 Fwy. Nice hotel but I found the room (king with a sleeper sofa) on the small side, although it was otherwise comfortable. Also we could hear quite a bit of noise from the hall and neighboring rooms. No mini fridge but I think that's typical for Courtyards. No free continental breakfast: they have a buffet breakfast which was good but expensive (almost $11.00). There's a small concession area near the front desk where you can buy snacks and even beer. I saw two fast food restaurants within walking distance but other restaurants require a short drive or a longer walk. Staff were polite, the grounds were clean. Note that the Marriott website

The hotel grounds are attractive and clean. Each day of my 5-night stay, I observed grounds staff engaged in a variety of tasks.  There is ample parking available on three sides of the property.  The location of the Courtyard Inn is central to various shopping and dining locations, as well as the airport.  It is essential to have a car, however, as it can be several blocks to a couple of miles to any shopping or dining. In addition, there is no shuttle for the airport, requiring an $18 cab fare each way.  The staff at the hotel were great. Check-in personnel were helpful and friendly.  On the first day of my stay, I was tied up in preparing reports and asked that housekeeping only leave fresh towels; the housekeeping staff asked three times if I as sure that everything was okay.

won this place with a $50 bid plus taxes one night via priceline.  It's about a 10 minute drive to any freeway.  Checkin at 5pm, few cars in the lot.  The clerk was fast and gave me a choice of four floors, which to me seems unusual for a priceline stay.  Also, she ask for my Marriott Rewards number and I did not have it on me.  She actually searched it via zip code, don't know if I will get any points, but was surprised she went through with all the work.  Room was clean and looked like this place was no more than ten years old.  Coffee and tea bags in the lobby and there were cookies too. My son and I were visiting town for an extended weekend while visiting family.  I have nothing but good things to say about the staff and the room.  The room was spacious, the beds comfortable, and the staff was friendly and accomodating.  We had breakfast with my family every morning so we didn't get to check out the breakfast buffet.  It was also a little chilly so we didn't swim but the pool area looked beautiful.  The hotel was 5 minutes from John Wayne and maybe 10-15 from the Disney area via the nearby freeways.  Also nearby are restaurants, movie theaters and South Coast Plaza.  I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

This particular Courtyard is one of the older, original prototype designed ones with the outdoor pool in the center courtyard along with a partially enclosed jacuzzi. I had not been to the hotel in several years and found it in very nice shape with what looked like a recent remodel.  For being at least 15 years old, the hotel looks sparkling.  Rooms, hallways and grounds were all perfect.  The only downsides here are that the rooms are very small, say, compared to a similarly priced Hilton Garden Inn, and the location is not exactly perfect.  There's nowhere to walk to - you're pretty much trapped at the hotel unless you want to get in the car.  For those who are traveling between San Diego and Los Angeles, it's a good stopping off point and it's very close to the 405 freeway,

Summary Heading: Easy access from the freeway but noisy
Summary: The room looked recently remodeled and the bed was comfortable but it didn’t seem to matter because the windows didn’t do much to block the sound of traffic from the busy street. Car alarms from the parking lot below also awoke us in the early a.m. hours.   We were also given a “non-smoking” room but when we entered it, it smelled of smoke and there was an ash tray and matches on the desk. After our long trip, we were too tired to complain so that is partially our fault. If you hate the smell of smoke, make sure you verify that your room is located no where near smoking rooms during check in.

Our stay at this Courtyard this past weekend was excellent!! The room was clean, down to the shower tub, and room service was prompt. The hotel's location is ideal and the view was great b/c the room overlooked the gazebo and pool. The hotel's staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. We'd definitely come back here next time we're in town.
